0.title: Assamese actor Kishor Das passes away aged 30 after battling cancer for over a year
0.article_body: Popular Assamese actor Kishor Das passed away aged 30 in Chennai after battling cancer for over a year. Kishor, who hailed from Mirza, was also suffering from COVID-19 complications at the time of his death. As per a report, his last rites were performed in Chennai as his mortal remains couldn't be brought to hometown due to coronavirus pandemic protocols.

1.title: Thousands asked to evacuate as Australia's Sydney braces for floods
1.article_body: Thousands of people were ordered to evacuate in Australia's Sydney as torrential rainfall and winds battered the region. The authorities have warned of heavy rainfall that could lead to flash floods and landslides along the east coast region. "We are now facing dangers on multiple fronts - flash flooding, riverine flooding and coastal erosion," said an official.

2.title: TV anchor falsely claims Rahul Gandhi called Udaipur killers 'children'; FIR filed
2.article_body: An FIR has been filed against TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and others for allegedly misrepresenting Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the vandalisation of his office in Kerala as his statement on Udaipur killing. Rahul called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but his comments were aired as remarks on Udaipur murder accused.

3.title: He was good friends with accused, knew him since 2006: Brother of killed Amravati chemist
3.article_body: Mahesh Kolhe, the brother of Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe who was killed over his post supporting ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma, said that his brother was good friends with Yusuf Khan (arrested accused), a practicing veterinarian. Mahesh Kolhe added, "We knew him since 2006." Seven accused, including alleged mastermind Shaikh Irfan Shaikh Rahim, have been arrested in the case so far.

4.title: Guv says blasts killed 3 in Russian city; lawmaker blames Ukraine
4.article_body: At least three people were killed and 50 buildings were damaged due to blasts in Russian city of Belgorod, which is located near Ukraine border, the regional Governor said on Sunday. Russian lawmaker Andrey Klishas claimed that the blasts were a "direct act of aggression on the part of Ukraine". Klishas also called for a "severe" response to the incident.

5.title: 18-yr-old Odisha student dies by suicide in college hostel, alleges ragging
5.article_body: An 18-year-old girl pursuing BA (Honours) History in Odisha's college allegedly died by suicide in her hostel room alleging ragging and torture by her seniors. The girl stayed back in her room and locked it from inside when her roommates left to attend classes at around 10 am, hostel's superintendent said. The girl's mother urged the police to find culprits.

6.title: Need development but not at cost of environment: Amit Thackeray on Aarey shed plan
6.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s son Amit Thackeray called Eknath Shinde-led government’s move to build the metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey colony, "shocking". "We definitely need development but not at the cost of environment," Amit said. "If our environment is completely destroyed then there will be no one left for politics or to be ruled upon," he added.

7.title: Delhi govt's finance dept seeks list of officers for early retirement
7.article_body: The Delhi government's finance department has directed all of its departments to provide a list of officers who can be considered for premature retirement. The officers who are nearing retirement age and are found to be ineffective are likely to be included in that list, officials said. The departmental heads have been asked to treat the matter as "most urgent".

8.title: Will distribute 21,000 acres land I freed from mafias to poor: MP CM
8.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that he has freed 21,000 acres of land from clutches of mafias in the state and  announced that he will distribute these lands among poor. "Some influential people encroach upon acres of land due to their muscle power and rowdyism. They should know that Shivraj Singh Chouhan will not spare them," he added.

9.title: Hand grenade thrown at religious school in Afghanistan; 8 injured
9.article_body: At least eight people were injured after a hand grenade was thrown at a religious school in Afghanistan's Nangarhar province on Saturday, Xinhua reported citing local media. This came as a meeting of religious scholars and elders in Kabul was set to conclude the same day. All the injured people were taken to a hospital, a police spokesperson said.

10.title: Test cricket seems very easy for Jasprit Bumrah: Ajit Agarkar
10.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajit Agarkar has praised India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah for his performance in the ongoing Test against England. "Bowl well, get wickets, get runs, become captain, and put India in a terrific position...Test cricket seems very easy [for Bumrah]," stated Agarkar. Bumrah scored 31*(16) in the first innings and has picked three wickets so far in the match.

11.title: BJP will win in Telangana Assembly polls next year: Keshav Maurya
11.article_body: On his visit to Hyderabad, Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Keshav Prasad Maurya said that BJP will win the next year's Telangana Assembly elections. "Today I took [the] blessing of Mata Bhagyalaxmi here (Hyderabad) at Charminar. I request Telangana people to visit devotional places in Uttar Pradesh. We will come to power," Maurya said.

12.title: Actress Mahhi Vij's cook arrested for threatening to kill her and her family with 'khanjar'
12.article_body: Actress Mahhi Vij's cook has been arrested for allegedly threatening to kill her and her family with 'khanjar' (dagger). As per the police, the cook had issued death threats following a salary dispute. Mahhi had also stated that the cook had hurled abuses at her family and also added that he was stealing from them.

13.title: Ola Electric sees 32 high-level exits in 2 years as Head of Charging Network resigns
13.article_body: The Senior Director and Business Head of Charging Network at Ola Electric Mobility has resigned from the company after joining in March 2021. Yashwant Kumar's exit comes days after the resignation of Ranjit Kondeshan who was the HR Director at Ola Electric. According to ET Auto, this is the 32nd high-level exit from the company in the last two years.

14.title: Grateful to Thor team's imagination to cast 5'3" actress in 6-ft role: Natalie
14.article_body: Natalie Portman, who'll be seen as The Mighty Thor in 'Thor: Love and Thunder', said that she's grateful to everyone's imagination to cast a five-three actress in a six-foot role. "That takes a real leap of possibility in your mind and probably not something I'll, you know, get...opportunity to do, to be imagined as, by any other group," she added.

15.title: I have to say I was wrong: Nadal on calling opponent to net in middle of match
15.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal has apologised for calling Lorenzo Sonego to the net in the middle of their third-round match at Wimbledon. Nadal reportedly had an exchange over Sonego's 'loud grunts' during points. "I have to say I was wrong. I shouldn't (have) called him to the net," stated Nadal, who won with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-2, 6-4.

16.title: Preity shares pic with Hrithik, Sussanne, Sonali; says 'A night to remember'
16.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share a picture showing her posing with Hrithik Roshan, Sussanne Khan, Arslan Goni, Sonali Bendre and Gene Goodenough. "A night to remember #memories," she captioned the picture. Reacting to Preity's post, a fan wrote, "90s kids would love it." Preity and Hrithik worked together in several movies, including 'Mission Kashmir' and 'Lakshya'.

17.title: 2 teenagers killed, 1 man wounded in shooting in US' Texas
17.article_body: Two teenage boys were killed and a 20-year-old man was wounded in a shooting that took place at a Houston-area apartment complex in US' Texas, said authorities. While the teenagers were declared dead at a hospital, the injured victim is expected to survive. An official said the confrontation may have started at a pool party.

18.title: I'm really looking forward to Saif's performance in Vikram Vedha: Madhavan
18.article_body: R Madhavan, who played the role of Vikram in Tamil film 'Vikram Vedha', spoke about the film's upcoming remake which stars Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan. He said that he's looking forward to Saif's performance as Vikram in the film. "I want to know whether he'll beat me, and make it more convincing because I've...feeling he will," Madhavan said.

19.title: Our best line of defence is attack; Eng batters are aggressive: Anderson
19.article_body: After England's score being at 84/5 at stumps on Day two of the fifth Test, pacer James Anderson feels that the team's "best line of defence" on Sunday will be to attack. "The way we've got out of sticky situations is trying to put pressure back on the opposition...Our batters are naturally aggressive...We've been in this position before," Anderson said.

20.title: Udaipur district administration relaxes curfew from 8 am to 6 pm today
20.article_body: Udaipur's district administration has decided to relax the curfew for 10 hours today, District Magistrate Tara Chand Meena said. The curfew will be relaxed from 8 am to 6 pm, the District Magistrate added. The curfew had been imposed on June 28 in the district after the beheading of a tailor for supporting suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma.

21.title: Will miss Aarey protest, have to attend Assembly session: Aaditya
21.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said he would miss the protest for Aarey forest as he has to attend the State Assembly session. He urged the newly-formed CM Eknath Shinde-led government to reconsider its decision to build the metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey colony. "Don't cast the hate for us on to our beloved Mumbai," he tweeted.

22.title: BJP's Rahul Narwekar to be the new Maharashtra Assembly Speaker
22.article_body: First-time Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Rahul Narwekar will be the new Maharashtra Assembly Speaker. He won 164 votes, while 144 is the halfway mark. An advocate by profession, Narwekar, who had been associated with the Shiv Sena as well as the NCP in the past, joined the BJP in the run-up to the October 2019 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

23.title: 2 armed LeT terrorists caught by villagers in J&K; ₹7 lakh reward announced for them
23.article_body: Two armed Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists, Faizal Ahmed Dar and Talib Hussain, were overpowered and handed over to the police by villagers in Jammu and Kashmir's Reasi district on Sunday. Two AK assault rifles, seven grenades and a pistol were recovered from them, officials said. A reward of ₹7 lakh was announced for the villagers by the Lieutenant Governor and DGP.

24.title: Non-inclusive approach an invitation to disaster: CJI NV Ramana
24.article_body: CJI NV Ramana on Saturday said that in the 21st century, we cannot allow petty, narrow and divisive issues to dictate human and societal relationships. "We have to rise above all the divisive issues to remain focused on human development. A non-inclusive approach is an invitation to disaster," CJI added.

25.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states until July 7, list released
25.article_body: IMD has issued heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs amid monsoon until July 7. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Gujarat, Goa, Karnataka and Kerala. It's likely over Maharashtra from July 4 to 7, and over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from July 5 to 7. Heavy rainfall is also very likely over Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh in next few days.

26.title: Totally false: Cong on report of Rahul seeking AIADMK's support for Prez election
26.article_body: Congress refuted a report which claimed that Rahul Gandhi called up AIADMK's Edappadi K Palaniswami to seek support for Opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha. "This is wholly bogus and totally false. No such phone call was made. The DMK-Congress alliance is firm and steadfast enough to withstand such crude and mischievous efforts to sow confusion and weaken it," Congress said.

27.title: Biden asks oil firms to lower prices amid 'war & global peril', Bezos responds
27.article_body: The world's second-richest person Jeff Bezos responded to a tweet by US President Joe Biden, who asked oil companies to lower their prices amid "war and global peril". Bezos wrote, "Ouch. Inflation is far too important a problem for the White House to keep making statements like this. It's either straight ahead misdirection or a...misunderstanding of basic market dynamics."

28.title: Scrapping Article 377 hasn't helped LGBTQ in smaller cities: Sarathi Trust
28.article_body: Nagpur-based Sarathi Trust Founder Anand Chandrani said that even after Article 377 has been scrapped, the LGBTQIA+ community still faces discrimination in society predominantly in smaller cities. "When we organise private get-togethers in Nagpur, around 300-400 people come, but when it comes to Pride marches or any public events, you will find only 80-100 people," he added.

29.title: Cong leader says 'Deve Gowda will soon be carried by 4'; apologises
29.article_body: Following criticism, Congress leader KN Rajanna has apologised for his remarks on former PM HD Deve Gowda in which he apparently suggested that the latter's end was near, saying, "I regret if my words have hurt him, his family or well-wishers...I apologise." Earlier, Rajanna said, "Deve Gowda is presently being carried by two people. Soon, four people will carry him."

30.title: RRR finishes 2nd at H'wood Critics Association Awards; beats Top Gun 2, Batman
30.article_body: Ram Charan and Jr NTR starrer 'RRR' finished runner-up in the Best Picture category at the Hollywood Critics Association Midseason Awards, beating movies such as 'The Batman' and 'Top Gun: Maverick'. The award for Best Picture went to Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's adventure comedy 'Everything Everywhere All At Once'. 'RRR' was directed by SS Rajamouli.

31.title: Don't want to be known as a drunkard who crashes his car: Madhavan
31.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, on being asked how he maintains the image of a complete family man along with doing good work, said, "I don't want to be known as a drunkard who crashes his car." "I am a really shy person," he added. "I've only restricted myself to Amitabh Bachchan's Diwali party and Shah Rukh's (Khan) birthday party," said Madhavan.

32.title: Insulted institution of both CM, PM: Union Minister as T'gana CM skips welcoming PM
32.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped PM Narendra Modi’s welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport on Saturday, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "Telangana CM has insulted the institution of both CM and PM". "CM KCR can hide but his corrupt politics will not remain hidden," Pradhan added. "Cooperative federalism in letter and spirit is cornerstone of our democracy," he stated.

33.title: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction seals legislative party office
33.article_body: Ahead of the special session in Maharashtra Assembly to elect the Speaker, rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led faction sealed the legislative party office in the Vidhan Bhavan. The rebel MLAs have arrived at the Vidhan Sabha after leaving Hotel Trident in Mumbai. BJP MLAs, including Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis, have also arrived.

34.title: Amazon delivery agent saves girl after metal piece pierces her cheek at school in Thane
34.article_body: An Amazon delivery agent helped in saving a child after a part of a metal gate pierced through her cheek while she was playing in her school in Thane. Until help arrived, the agent held onto the metal gate for 30 minutes to ensure it would not injure the girl any further. The incident was shared online by a resident.

35.title: Not sure how I bullied him: Kyrgios after Tsitsipas calls him 'evil bully' after match
35.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas called Nick Kyrgios a "bully" after he lost the third-round match 7-6(7-2), 4-6, 3-6, 6-7(7-9) against the Australian in the ongoing Wimbledon 2022. "Kyrgios bullies opponents. He was probably a bully at school. I don't like bullies," Tsitsipas had said after the match. "I'm not sure how I bullied him...I did nothing disrespectful," replied Kyrgios.

36.title: Zee News anchor falsely claims Rahul Gandhi called Udaipur killers 'children'; FIR filed
36.article_body: An FIR has been filed against Zee News anchor Rohit Ranjan, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and others for allegedly misrepresenting Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the vandalisation of his office in Kerala as his statement on Udaipur killing. Rahul called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but the channel aired his comment as remarks on Udaipur murder accused.

37.title: Rare transparent fish found in Alaska, pic surfaces
37.article_body: Deep-sea scientists have discovered a rare transparent fish during a routine survey in Alaska. Sharing a picture, Sarah Friedman, a fish biologist at National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), tweeted, "Been hoping to see one of these in person for a long time! Blotched snailfish (Crystallichthys cyclospilus)." The blotched snailfish camouflage themselves to be invisible to predators.

38.title: Important to follow right footsteps: Aaditya in 1st Insta post after govt collapse
38.article_body: Former Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray posted for the first time on Instagram after the fall of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government and shared a picture of him walking behind father Uddhav Thackeray. His post read, "Always important to follow the right footsteps. Indebted to all for your love and blessings that keep coming our way, that is our true strength."

39.title: Fire breaks out in train's engine in Bihar; all passengers safe
39.article_body: A fire broke out in the engine of a DMU train near the Bhelwa railway station in Bihar on Sunday. While the cause of the blaze is yet to be ascertained, all the passengers aboard the train were evacuated and are safe as the fire didn't spread. A video of the fire shows the engine in flames and smoke billowing.

40.title: Bajrang Dal, VHP members summoned over Gurugram protest after FIR
40.article_body: Gurugram Police summoned Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) members a day after booking them for allegedly raising abusive slogans during a protest demanding action over the Udaipur killing. "No arrests have been made so far. The probe is underway," said police. The protesters, in purported videos, were heard shouting, "Desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaro..."

41.title: RPF seized narcotics worth over ₹7.40 cr last month: Railway Ministry
41.article_body: Railway Protection Force (RPF) seized narcotics worth over ₹7.40 crore and arrested 165 persons who were carrying NDPS under Operation "NARCOS" in June 2022, the Railway Ministry said. "RPF intensified its checks in trains and identified black spots across the country in coordination with NCB and other LEA's to target drug peddlers," the Railway Ministry said in its release.

42.title: Delhi Police busts illicit liquor factory; 1 arrested
42.article_body: Delhi Police busted an illicit liquor factory in New Usmanpur and arrested one person. A police team, while patrolling the area, sensed a foul smell similar to liquor, after which they searched a nearby house. They recovered a plastic drum containing approximately 220 litres of illicit liquor, 50 sealed quarter bottles and plastic containers containing chemicals, among other materials.

43.title: India records 16,103 new COVID-19 cases, 31 deaths in last 24 hours
43.article_body: India has reported 16,103 new COVID-19 cases, 13,929 recoveries and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload currently stands at 1,11,711, while the daily positivity rate has reached 4.27%. The country's COVID-19 death toll has reached 5,25,199.

44.title: Will behead myself if I've done anything wrong: Karnataka HC Judge
44.article_body: Karnataka High Court Judge Justice B Veerappa has said that he is "upset" over advocates making false and baseless charges against judges and urged them to stay away from this. "If I've done anything wrong, I'm ready to stand between Vidhana Soudha and High Court and behead myself," he added. Veerappa was speaking at an Advocates Association Bengaluru (AAB) event.

45.title: Is Zak Crawley comfortable being this 'inconsistent talent': Nasser
45.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said England opener Zak Crawley needs to think if he's comfortable being "this inconsistent talent" in Test cricket. "It's the repetitive nature of dismissals that [will] eventually, become a concern," added Nasser. Crawley was dismissed for 9(17) in the ongoing Test against India, which was his ninth single-figure score in his last 11 Test innings.

46.title: MP sarpanch raises anti-national slogans after poll win; probe on
46.article_body: The police have launched a probe after a video showing a sarpanch in Madhya Pradesh's Katni village allegedly raising anti-national slogans along with his supporters after winning local elections went viral. In the video, the sarpanch and his supporters were purportedly heard raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans. "We have registered [a] case in the matter," a police official said.

47.title: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi's ex-husband Athar Aamir Khan gets engaged, shares pic
47.article_body: IAS 2015 rank 2 and Srinagar Municipal Corporation (SMC) Commissioner Athar Aamir Khan, who got divorced with IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi last year, got engaged to Mehreen, who is a doctor. Athar took to Instagram to share a picture with Mehreen. In April this year, Tina got married to Dr Pradeep Gawande, a 2013-batch IAS officer.

48.title: Sad to lose my record, suffered for 19 yrs, jokes Peterson on Broad's most expensive over
48.article_body: Ex-South Africa spinner Robin Peterson reacted to England's Stuart Broad bowling the costliest over in Test history. Peterson jokingly wrote, "Sad to lose my record today...Oh well...records are made to be broken I guess." Peterson jokingly added he suffered for 19 years. Peterson jointly held the previous record after he was hit for 28 runs by Brian Lara in 2003.

49.title: Nitish Kumar is NDA and NDA is Nitish Kumar in Bihar: JD(U)'s Upendra Kushwaha
49.article_body: JD(U)’s Upendra Kushwaha said, "Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is NDA and NDA is Nitish Kumar in Bihar". "He's been leading the coalition since it came into being...He will continue to do so as long as NDA exists in Bihar," Kushwaha added. His statement came days after Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said Kumar will complete his current term as Bihar CM.

50.title: Will discuss it at appropriate platform: Law Minister Rijiju on SC's remarks on Nupur
50.article_body: After the Supreme Court criticised former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said he will discuss the issue at an appropriate platform. "Even if I don't like the judgement or I have serious objection to the manner in which the observations are made, I would not like to comment," he said.

51.title: Varun in talks with Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 director Anees for comedy film: Report
51.article_body: Varun Dhawan is in conversations with 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee for a comedy film, according to a report. "If all goes as planned, the comic caper will go on floors by next year-end," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. Varun, who was most recently seen in 'JugJugg Jeeyo', will next be seen in the horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'.

52.title: Man sarcastically says he has 'bomb' in his luggage at Cochin airport; arrested
52.article_body: A 63-year-old man and his wife were denied boarding at the Cochin International Airport on Saturday after the man sarcastically remarked that his bag had a "bomb" when asked about the contents of his luggage. As per the police, the man did not like the extensive security checking at the airport. He was arrested and later released on bail.

53.title: 100-year-old British-era passport revived by Pune-based institute
53.article_body: A 100-year-old passport issued by the British government to Bhaskar Gangadhar Kelkar, an MBBS graduate looking to go to London for higher studies, was restored by the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) in Pune. According to BORI Chairman Bhupal Patwardhan, the life of the passport, which was issued in August 1921, has been enhanced to last 60 more years.

54.title: Four teens arrested for stealing jewellery worth ₹2 lakh from Mumbai temple
54.article_body: Four teenagers were arrested for allegedly stealing ornaments worth ₹2 lakh from the Kalimata Temple at Anand Nagar in Dahisar East, Mumbai. The accused were arrested after a resident reported the theft of a gold necklace and gold bangles from the idol, police said. Notably, two of the accused are 19 years old, while the remaining two are minors.

55.title: Mumbai man gets 1-month jail for holding cousin's hand, proposing marriage
55.article_body: A 43-year-old Mumbai-based man was awarded one month imprisonment by Mulund court for holding his young cousin's hand 13 years ago and asking her to marry him. A man has no right to touch a woman's body without her permission, even if he is her relative, the court stated. The minor had lodged a complaint on February 2, 2009.

56.title: AAP members to send ₹420 cheques to PM in protest against 'Agnipath': Sanjay Singh
56.article_body: AAP members will send cheques and demand drafts (DDs) for ₹420 to PM Narendra Modi in a symbolic protest against the 'Agnipath' scheme, AAP's Sanjay Singh said. He added, PM would be told not to do "char sau bisi (cheating)" with the Indian Army and the party would appeal to government “to not cry for money to protect the country.”

57.title: One of the key accused in 2002 Godhra train coach burning case gets life term
57.article_body: Godhra sessions court has awarded the 2002 Godhra train coach burning accused Rafiq Hussain Bhatuk life imprisonment under the conspiracy to murder charge, special public prosecutor RC Kodekar said. Bhatuk was part of the "core group" of accused persons involved in the conspiracy, police said. Absconding for 19 years, he was arrested by Gujarat Police from Godhra town last year.

58.title: Tesla deliveries drop by 18% in Q2 due to COVID-19 shutdown in China
58.article_body: Due to China's COVID-19-related shutdown and its subsequent disruption of the company's production and supply chain, Tesla delivered 17.9% fewer electric vehicles in the second quarter than the previous quarter. Tesla said while June 2022 was the highest vehicle production month in the company's history, the preceding quarter ended a nearly two-year-long run of record quarterly deliveries.

59.title: Pretty unlucky, there were plenty of top edges: Anderson on Broad's 35-run over
59.article_body: England pacer James Anderson has said Stuart Broad was "pretty unlucky" in conceding 35 runs from his 18th over in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against India. "On another day, when the luck was with Stuart, an edge probably would've gone to hand," added Anderson. Bumrah scored 29 runs off the over, while the remaining came off extras.

60.title: Some 'qualitative' changes in him: Pawar on Maha Guv offering sweets to Shinde
60.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar reacted to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari feeding sweets to CM Eknath Shinde during his swearing-in ceremony and said that he has seen some "qualitative changes" in the governor's treatment of public representatives. Koshyari also did not object to Shinde mentioning names of Balasaheb Thackeray, Anand Dighe while taking oath, which he did earlier, Pawar added.

61.title: Lindsay Lohan reveals she is married to Dubai-based financier Shammas, shares pic
61.article_body: Actress Lindsay Lohan took to Instagram to reveal that she tied the knot with Dubai-based financier Bader Shammas. "I'm the luckiest woman in the world...I am stunned that this is my husband. My life and my everything," she wrote. In November last year, Lohan announced her engagement to Shammas. Lohan's representatives confirmed to 'People' that she has tied the knot.

62.title: PMC collects 593 kg of plastics, files 30 cases in 2 days
62.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) collected 593 kg of plastics in two days since the nationwide ban on single-use plastics came into effect. It also filed 30 cases against the violators. "The fines range from ₹5,000, ₹10,000 to ₹25,000. If violation continues after the third penalty, an FIR will be lodged," said an official.

63.title: Bangalore Development Authority officials booked over ₹100 cr land scam
63.article_body: Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) officials were booked on Saturday for allegedly swapping prime land with another parcel of property resulting in a ₹100 crore loss, the agency's Chairman SR Vishwanath said. He added that the officials had colluded with a person named Nagaraj and called it a "mega scam". He also ordered a BDA task force to probe all documents.

64.title: 28-year-old web series actress arrested for biting & manhandling policewoman in Pune
64.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 28-year-old woman, who has acted in a few web series, for allegedly biting and manhandling a policewoman on duty. Police said the actress, currently residing in Andheri, Mumbai, is an original resident of Karnataka. Parvin Shaikh, attached to the Damini Squad of Pune city police, lodged an FIR at Chandan Nagar police station.

65.title: Bumrah takes 3 wickets after setting world record, England trail by 332 runs after Day 2
65.article_body: India captain Jasprit Bumrah took three wickets as England ended the second day of rescheduled fifth Test at 84/5 in their first innings, trailing India by 332 runs. Earlier in the day, Bumrah broke world record for scoring the most runs in an over in a Test (29), helping India post 416/10. James Anderson picked five wickets for England.

66.title: Union Minister Shekhawat useless, absent-minded in meetings: Raj CM
66.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot called Union Minister Gajendra Shekhawat "useless" and said that he remains "absent-minded" during PM Narendra Modi's meetings. He stated, "We'll ask the PM someday why he keeps such a nikamma (useless) minister who remains absent-minded in your meetings." Gehlot's remark was over an alleged denial by Shekhawat about PM Modi's "promise" regarding a canal project.

67.title: 2 kids killed due to wall collapse amid heavy rain in Rajasthan
67.article_body: Two children were killed in a rain-related incident after a wall collapsed on them in Rajasthan's Chhatargarh. The deceased, who were brothers, have been identified as 10-year-old Rakesh Kumar and 8-year-old Anil Kumar, police said. The duo was sleeping in their house when the incident occurred. Heavy rainfall has been recorded in several parts of Rajasthan since Friday.

68.title: State govt will regularise services of pourakarmikas: K'taka CM
68.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said the state government will regularise services of pourakarmikas who work on direct payment. This comes after over 15,000 pourakarmikas went on an indefinite strike from Friday in Bengaluru seeking permanent jobs and better pay. "We've agreed to extend social security, medical services and assistance for education of children of pourakarmikas," he said.

69.title: 5 of a family, including 2 minors, found dead in house in Kerala
69.article_body: Police said that five members of a family, including two minor children, were found dead in their house near Kallambalam in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday morning. "Prima facie it is a suspected case of suicide," a police official said. "As per the indications received, the family was worried about some financial issues," the official added.

70.title: Wanted to play against Serena and Venus in singles at Wimbledon: Sania
70.article_body: On being asked who she would've liked to play against but never got the chance at Wimbledon, ex-women's doubles world number one Sania Mirza said Serena and Venus Williams in singles. "I did play them in doubles but never in singles," she added. Sania, who entered mixed doubles second round at Wimbledon 2022, is competing in her last season.

71.title: 'Vikasvad defeating Parivarvad' under PM Modi's leadership: Nadda
71.article_body: Speaking at BJP national executive meet in Hyderabad, party chief JP Nadda lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said, "Vikasvad is defeating Parivarvad" under PM Modi's leadership, an ANI report said. Dynasty politics is being rejected by people due to politics of development, he added. He lauded PM Modi for the electoral victories of the BJP including UP and Manipur.

72.title: 2 electrocuted by broken live wire in West Bengal's Bankura
72.article_body: Two people were electrocuted in West Bengal's Bankura district on Saturday morning, police said. They said that 62-year-old Parbati Ghosh was electrocuted when she came in contact with a live wire that had broken during overnight thunderstorms and rains. When 58-year-old Ananga Ghosh tried to rescue her, he too was electrocuted, police added.

73.title: World no. 1 Swiatek crashes out of Wimbledon as Cornet ends her 37-match winning streak
73.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek was knocked out of Wimbledon in third round by French tennis player Alizé Cornet. With the defeat, Swiatek's 37-match winning streak came to an end. Swiatek lost the match with a scoreline of 4-6, 2-6. In June, Swiatek had defeated Coco Gauff in the French Open 2022 final to bag her second Roland Garros title.

74.title: Hostellers clash at Guwahati's Cotton University, several injured
74.article_body: Many students were injured in a clash between inmates of two hostels of Cotton University in Guwahati on Saturday, officials said. A group of inmates of a boys hostel allegedly threw bricks and bottles at another hostel around 1.45 am, to which a few students retaliated, officials added. A case was filed and the probe has begun, police said.

75.title: Amravati police chief tried to hide chemist's killing by calling it robbery: MP Navneet
75.article_body: MP Navneet Rana has sought action against Amravati Police Commissioner Aarti Singh over the June 21 killing of chemist Umesh Kolhe who had supported Nupur Sharma. Rana alleged that Singh tried to "suppress the case" by passing it off as a robbery. "After 12 days she's giving clarification on the incident...(An) enquiry must be done against [her]," said Rana.

76.title: The way Bumrah batted reflects team's positive mindset in 5th Test: Zaheer
76.article_body: Reflecting on stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah's 31*(16) in the first innings of fifth India-England Test, Zaheer Khan said, "The way Bumrah batted reflects the team's positive mindset. The momentum is now with India." Bumrah scored 29 runs in an over by Stuart Broad. "It was a hugely entertaining over," Zaheer added. India were bowled out for 416 in first innings.

77.title: Man who 'masterminded' Amravati chemist's killing for supporting Nupur arrested
77.article_body: The seventh accused in the murder of Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe has been arrested, police said on Saturday. The accused, identified as Shaikh Irfan Shaikh Rahim, was the mastermind of the killing, police said. Kolhe was killed on June 21 in retaliation for WhatsApp posts supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

78.title: Germany to return Benin Bronzes to Nigeria
78.article_body: Germany and Nigeria have agreed for the return of artefacts, called Benin Bronzes, which were looted from Africa in the 19th Century. The Nigerian government said it would be receiving 1,130 pieces, describing it as the "single largest repatriation of artefacts anywhere in the world". Two pieces kept with the Berlin museum were handed over at the signing meet.

79.title: Maharashtra CM Shinde, rebel Sena MLAs arrive in Mumbai from Goa
79.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, along with his faction of MLAs, on Saturday evening reached Mumbai from Goa, where the rebel Shiv Sena MLAs were camping after returning from Assam's Guwahati. This comes after Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray removed Shinde from the post of leader in the party for indulging in "anti-party activities".

80.title: Pic shows Uber charging ₹3,000 for ride within Mumbai amid rains, Twitter users react
80.article_body: A Twitter user named Shravankumar Suvarna shared a screenshot that showed Uber charging ₹3,041 for a ride within Mumbai. "Flight to Goa is cheaper than my ride home #peakmumbairains," he wrote. "This is extortion not surge pricing," a Twitter user commented. "You can probably get a flight to [Pune] and then take a bus. It'd still...be cheaper," another comment read.

81.title: Typhoon destroys ship off Hong Kong coast; over 2 dozen missing
81.article_body: More than two dozen people were missing after an engineering ship was destroyed by a violent tropical storm, Typhoon Chaba, 300 km off the coast of Hong Kong, officials said on Saturday. Only three crew members have been rescued till now. The typhoon generated wind speeds of 144 km/ph and 10-metre high waves at the location of hitting the ship.

82.title: 6.3 magnitude earthquake hits southern Iran; 5 killed, 44 injured
82.article_body: Five people have died and 44 others have been wounded due to a magnitude 6.3 earthquake that hit southern Iran on Saturday, state media reported. Sayeh Khosh village, 1,000 kilometres south of capital Tehran, in the Hormozgan province has been identified as the epicentre. Tremors from the earthquake were felt in many neighbouring countries, as per the state media.

83.title: Philippines' President vetoes sister's bill for new economic zone
83.article_body: Philippines' President, Ferdinand Marcos Jr, has vetoed a bill sponsored by his lawmaker sister that proposed the creation of a new special economic zone. In his letter to the Congress, Marcos stated, "Fiscal prudence must be exercised particularly at times when resources are scarce and the needs are abundant." Marcos' administration has inherited a government debt of over $200 billion.

84.title: UN, EU condemn Libyan protesters vandalising Parliament building
84.article_body: The United Nations and European Union on Saturday condemned Libyan protesters who vandalised the Parliament Building in Tobruk on Friday, expressing anger against recent hours-long power cuts. Protests demanding electricity were also seen in capital Tripoli. Libya's Parliament shifted to Tobruk from Tripoli after its east-west split in 2014 which resulted in dictator Muammar Gadhafi's ouster.

85.title: Several self-driving cars simultaneously stop working in US, block traffic for hours
85.article_body: More than half a dozen self-driving cars of Cruise simultaneously stopped operating in a San Francisco street recently, blocking the traffic for a couple of hours. The company's employees arrived at the location and had to manually move the autonomous vehicles. Cruise acknowledged the incident without revealing the cause and said, "[The issue] was resolved and no passengers were impacted."

86.title: Two Syrian civilians injured in Israeli military strike in Tartous
86.article_body: Two civilians were injured on Saturday in an Israeli military strike targeting the Syrian province of Tartous, the country's military said. Syrian state news agency SANA reported that Israeli warplanes targeted chicken farms in Hamidiya town, south of Tartous. This is the latest in a series of military strikes that Israel claims is targeted at entities backed by Iran.

87.title: When tiger comes, foxes run away: BJP as T'gana CM skips welcoming PM
87.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport on Saturday, state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar said, "When the tiger comes, foxes run away." "Now, when the tiger has come, he (KCR) is running away. We do not know why is he doing this," Kumar further said.

88.title: Mohanlal receives certificate from CBIC for prompt filing, returns of GST
88.article_body: Actor Mohanlal announced that he received a certificate of appreciation from Finance Ministry's Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) over his prompt filing and returns of GST for the fiscal year 2021-2022. The actor also shared the certificate on social media on Saturday, writing, "I thank the Government of India for their appreciation. Proud to be an Indian."

89.title: Ukraine says link restored to Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant
89.article_body: Ukraine's nuclear power operator Energoatom on Friday informed that it had restored connection to the surveillance systems in the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant which is occupied by Russian forces. The agency added that all the mandatory monitoring data has been shared with UN's atomic watchdog, IAEA. The connection loss was caused due to "occupiers" cutting off all mobile operators, Energoatom said.

90.title: Inspired by vengeful spirit: Priyanka on ED action on Sanjay Raut
90.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised the Centre over action against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, saying it was "inspired by the spirit of revenge and malice". "BJP is adopting every trick to suppress the voices standing in opposition to its anti-democratic politics," Priyanka tweeted. This comes after Raut appeared before ED in connection with a money laundering case.

91.title: SRK, Ranbir, Karan Johar pose with Madhavan on 'Rocketry' set
91.article_body: A picture showing actors Shah Rukh Khan and Ranbir Kapoor along with filmmakers Ayan Mukerji and Karan Johar posing with R Madhavan and Nambi Narayanan has gone viral on social media. The picture was clicked on the sets of Madhavan's debut directorial 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' with him in makeup as Nambi. Shah Rukh makes a cameo appearance in it.

92.title: Anisimova beat fellow American Gauff to enter her first Wimbledon 4th round
92.article_body: American Amanda Anisimova reached the fourth round at Wimbledon for the first time after defeating compatriot and 11th seed Coco Gauff 6-7(4-7), 6-2, 6-1 on Saturday. The 20th seed won the third round match in two hours and seven minutes. It is Gauff's earliest defeat at Wimbledon. Anisimova will next face France's Harmony Tan, who beat wild card Katie Boulter.

93.title: I see my 5-day ED interrogation as a medal: Rahul Gandhi
93.article_body: Speaking in Wayanad, Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he views the five-day Enforcement Directorate interrogation he recently faced as a "medal". He also said, "I wondered why they interrogated me for 5 days, not for 10 days." Rahul Gandhi was interrogated by the ED several times in June over a money laundering case related to the National Herald newspaper.

94.title: By not welcoming PM, KCR jeopardised Constitution's integrity: Irani
94.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Smriti Irani on Saturday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao "jeopardised the integrity of the Constitution" by not attending PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at the Hyderabad airport. She said, "[KCR] has just not insulted an individual but also an institution." Notably, PM Modi arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting today.

95.title: I can tell you're an action hero: Chris Pratt to Sidharth Malhotra
95.article_body: In a recent interaction between the two, Hollywood actor Chris Pratt said that he can tell that actor Sidharth Malhotra is an action hero for sure. "Just look at this guy...We should work out together," he added. Chris and Sidharth also spoke about representing their nation's army personnel onscreen in the show 'The Terminal List' and the film 'Shershaah' respectively.

96.title: 44-year-old woman dies after being struck by lightning in UP
96.article_body: A 44-year-old woman, identified as Kaushali, died and another sustained injuries after being struck by lightning in Ballia district of Uttar Pradesh, police said. ASP of Ballia, Durga Prasad Tewari, said both the women were sowing paddy in their field when they were hit by lightning. Kaushali died on the spot, while another woman suffered serious injuries, ASP Tewari added.

97.title: BJP and RSS are capturing our Constitution: Rahul Gandhi in Kerala
97.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that India's Constitution is "being captured" by the BJP and the RSS. Gandhi stated, "Voice of people is being crushed. But we aren't scared, we won't let them destroy the fabric of the country." He added, "They are attacking the country's economic backbone." Rahul made the statements while addressing a gathering in Kerala.

98.title: Wasim Jaffer trolls England with pic of drunk Flintoff and Pietersen after India score 416
98.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer trolled England after India managed to score 416 runs in their first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. Sharing a picture of drunk Andrew Flintoff and Kevin Pietersen from 2005 Ashes celebrations, Jaffer wrote, "England: Indian total won't be that high. Meanwhile, Indian total: [picture reference] #ENGvIND."

99.title: 30 students injured as school bus falls into ditch in Bengal's Malda
99.article_body: At least 30 students were injured after the school bus they were travelling in fell into a roadside ditch in West Bengal's Malda district on Saturday afternoon, police said. Around 70 students were returning home on the bus when the accident took place, police added. "Two students received serious head injuries, but their condition is stable," Malda SP said.

100.title: Indians can receive up to ₹10 lakh/yr from relatives abroad as govt amends FCRA rules
100.article_body: The government has amended the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA), allowing citizens to receive up to ₹10 lakh per year from relatives staying abroad without disclosing it to the authorities. The limit was earlier set at ₹1 lakh. If the amount exceeds ₹10 lakh, those receiving funds will now have 90 days (instead of 30 days) to inform the government.

101.title: Video of Dravid, Kohli celebrating Jasprit Bumrah's world record goes viral
101.article_body: A video of Rahul Dravid and Virat Kohli celebrating Team India captain Jasprit Bumrah's world record against England has gone viral. In the video, Dravid and Kohli can be seen animatedly celebrating Bumrah's batting. Bumrah smashed four fours and two sixes in Stuart Broad's over. Broad conceded a total of 35 runs in that over, with Bumrah scoring 29 runs.

102.title: 'The Shining' actor Joe Turkel passes away at the age of 94
102.article_body: Actor Joe Turkel, known for 'The Shining' and 'Blade Runner', passed away aged 94 in a hospital in California. He had a 40-year-long career with over 140 acting credits to his name. He retired from acting after doing voice acting for the 'Blade Runner' video game spinoff in 1997. He finished his memoir 'The Misery of Success' before his demise.

103.title: We're 100% ready: Savita ahead of 1st match at Hockey Women's World Cup
103.article_body: Indian women's hockey team captain Savita has said the team's only aim right now is to get on to a good start in the Hockey Women's World Cup 2022 in Spain and Netherlands, adding the team is 100% ready. India will face England on Sunday in their first match in Pool B in Amstelveen, the Netherlands.

104.title: Piyush Goyal to release States' Startup Rankings 2021 on Monday
104.article_body: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will release the results of the third edition of Ranking of States' on Support to Startup Ecosystems on Monday. The third edition evaluated support provided by 24 states and seven UTs between October 2019-July 2021. The States' Startup Ranking Exercise had seven reform areas and 26 action points. Presently, there're over 30 states/UTs with start-up policies.

105.title: Anushka Sharma wraps first schedule of 'Chakda 'Xpress', shares pic
105.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to social media to share a picture of a cricket ball to announce the wrap-up of the first schedule of 'Chakda 'Xpress'. The movie is a biopic on Jhulan Goswami and will feature Anushka playing the role of the cricketer. This will mark the actress' return to films after four years after 2018 film 'Zero'.

106.title: Case filed against Kapil Sharma for breach of North America tour contract
106.article_body: A case has been filed against comedian Kapil Sharma for breaching his contract for the tour of North America in 2015. As per a new report, Sai USA Inc filed the lawsuit as Kapil was paid for six shows but he performed only five of them. The comedian had said he would pay for the loss, Sai USA Inc claimed.

107.title: World no. 115 Tan reaches last 16 for first time at Wimbledon 2022
107.article_body: World number 115 Harmony Tan has reached the fourth round of a Grand Slam for the first time in her career at Wimbledon 2022. She defeated wild card Katie Boulter 6-1, 6-1 in 51 minutes on Saturday. Earlier in the first round, the 24-year-old defeated seven-time champion Serena Williams. Notably, it is Tan's debut at the tournament.

108.title: India responds to US govt report on religious freedom, calls it 'biased & inaccurate'
108.article_body: India has responded after the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) designated India as a "country of particular concern" citing violations of religious freedom. Calling the report "biased and inaccurate", the government said, "These comments reflect a severe lack of understanding of India and its constitutional framework, its plurality and its democratic ethos."

109.title: Audience will have to contribute to change: Taapsee on pay disparity
109.article_body: Speaking about the pay disparity between male and female actors in Bollywood, Taapsee Pannu said that the audience will have to contribute to the change. "Pay parity is not about producers not wanting to give money," the actress added. She said that the audience makes advance bookings for male-driven films but waits for reviews before going for a female-driven film.

110.title: Murmu's victory is certain in Presidential polls: Himachal CM
110.article_body: Addressing a function in Himachal Pradesh's Baddi on Friday, state CM Jairam Thakur said NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu's victory is certain. "Her efforts for the development of tribal areas, education of girls and balanced development of all sections of the society are highly commendable," Thakur said. She has set an example for society throughout her life, Thakur added.

111.title: 35-year-old businessman shot dead, wife injured in Bihar's Katihar
111.article_body: A 35-year-old businessman, Meghnath Yadav, was shot dead by miscreants when he and his wife were returning from a temple in Bihar's Katihar on Saturday morning, police said. Yadav's wife sustained bullet injuries and is undergoing treatment at a hospital. "The deceased had a property dispute with his brother-in-law and the police have started a probe," said SHO Rajeev Jha.

112.title: 7 persons from Assam killed in Manipur landslide
112.article_body: Seven persons from Assam, including two security personnel, were killed in a landslide at Tupul yard railway construction camp in Manipur's Noney, officials said on Saturday. "So far, five persons from Morigaon have been confirmed to have been killed in the landslide," an official said. The death toll in the landslide has increased to 25, while 38 others are missing.

113.title: PM Modi thinks he is Brahma and is permanent: Telangana CM KCR
113.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday said, "[PM Narendra] Modi thinks he is Brahma and is permanent." "There will be political transformation. No one is permanent...People choose their leader, who gets to serve the nation," he added. Rao, daring BJP to topple his government in Telangana, said "I'll become free and then will topple your government in the Centre."

114.title: Was stopped at Delhi airport despite procuring visa: Pulitzer-winning Kashmiri journalist
114.article_body: Pulitzer-winning Kashmiri photojournalist Sanna Irshad Mattoo tweeted that she was stopped by immigration officials at Delhi airport and prevented from travelling to France on Saturday despite procuring a visa. "I wasn't given any reason but told I'd not be able to travel internationally," she added. Sanna was scheduled to travel to Paris for a book launch and photography exhibition.

115.title: I was never a daily soap actor, can't go back to it: Saumya Tandon
115.article_body: Actress Saumya Tandon said she doesn't see herself going back to the daily soap world, adding she was never a daily soap actor to begin with. Saumya portrayed Anita Mishra in 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai!' from 2015 to 2020. "Now is the time to explore the actor in me. I also plan to co-produce a short film," she added.

116.title: He's scared to face PM Modi: BJP as KCR skips PM's welcome at airport
116.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't attend PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport, BJP MLC N Ramchander Rao said that KCR is scared to face the PM. Meanwhile, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "[KCR] has insulted the institution of both...a CM and PM." Notably, PM Modi arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting on Saturday.

117.title: Jannik, I are some of the youngest players left in Wimbledon draw: Alcaraz
117.article_body: Following his third round win at Wimbledon 2022, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz said he and his fourth round opponent, 20-year-old Jannik Sinner, are some of the youngest players left in the draw currently. "Maybe the most talented. But there are a lot of other young guys who play incredibly well," he added. Alcaraz and Sinner are seeded fifth and 10th respectively.

118.title: Mainstream cinema is boring, all actors are interchangeable: Harsh Varrdhan
118.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor has stated that he sees the same repackaged and rehashed version of films in mainstream cinema, adding he finds them really boring. "[I] feel all actors are interchangeable in that format," he said. The actor further said that his 'Bhavesh Joshi Superhero' and 'Thar' stand out because they make very little compromise in terms of creativity.

119.title: PM Modi only believes in confrontation: Opposition's Prez candidate
119.article_body: Opposition's candidate for Presidential elections, Yashwant Sinha, on Saturday said PM Narendra Modi never believed in "consensus" but only "confrontation". He said the elections are being held under "extraordinary circumstances", adding that it is not a fight between two individuals but a battle of ideologies. Notably, BJP-led NDA has announced Draupadi Murmu's name as its Presidential candidate.

120.title: Kolkata Police issues lookout circular against Nupur Sharma
120.article_body: Kolkata Police on Saturday issued a lookout circular against suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. According to police, the circular was issued as Sharma reportedly failed to turn up after she was sent two notices for appearance for interrogation. Last month, widespread violence broke out in several districts over Sharma's remarks.

121.title: Veterinary doctor provoked others to murder Amravati man for supporting Nupur: Police
121.article_body: A 44-year-old veterinary doctor, identified as Yusuf Khan Bahadur Khan, had provoked others to murder Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe who was stabbed to death, police have said. Kolhe was killed for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police stated. "Khan had made a post on a WhatsApp group against Kolhe...This provoked the accused...and they decided to murder him," they added.

122.title: Why is July 2 celebrated as World UFO Day?
122.article_body: World UFO Day, celebrated on July 2, commemorates two days which are first widely reported UFO sightings. First sighting was reported on June 24, 1947, when aviator Kenneth Arnold claimed he saw a 'flying saucer'. Second incident was in New Mexico on July 2, when a ranch owner found debris around his pasture, believed to have fallen from UFO crash.

123.title: If you disagree, close your account: UK bank to customers upset by pronoun badges
123.article_body: UK-based Halifax has said that customers objecting to the company's decision to allow employees to display their pronouns on name badges can close their accounts. The controversy started after Halifax tweeted a picture of a name badge saying "Gemma (she/her/hers)", along with the caption, "Pronouns matter". Halifax said, "If you disagree with our values, you're welcome to close your account."

124.title: Telangana CM skips PM Modi's welcome at airport for the 3rd time, triggers row
124.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't attend PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at the airport as the latter arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting on Saturday. Notably, this is the third time that Rao has skipped PM Modi's welcome ceremony this year. It triggered a political row in the state with BJP criticising the CM's actions.

125.title: UK MP under investigation for sexual misconduct; suspended
125.article_body: Senior UK Parliamentarian Chris Pincher has been suspended from the Conservative Party and will be investigated over allegations of sexual misconduct that he drunkenly groped two men. UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has assented Pincher's suspension till the time he is investigated. Earlier, Pincher resigned as Deputy Chief Whip of the Conservative Party over the incident.

126.title: Fact-checker Mohammed Zubair denied bail, sent to 14-day judicial custody
126.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was on Saturday sent to 14-day judicial custody by the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate of the Patiala House Court in Delhi. His plea for bail has been rejected by the court. The 33-year-old was arrested and booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments in a tweet in 2018.

127.title: Free power, water, healthcare in MP if AAP wins civic polls: Kejriwal
127.article_body: AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday announced that his party would provide free water, electricity and healthcare if voted to power in Madhya Pradesh local body polls. "Congress and BJP have cheated you. Give us a chance...If we don't work, kick us out," he added. "I assure you Singrauli will be developed like Delhi," Kejriwal further said.

128.title: Travelled in locals, got pinched: Raveena to trolling on opposing metro
128.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon responded to a troll who said elites don't understand how Mumbaikers live, tweeting, "Teen yrs, travelled in locals/buses, got eveteased, pinched...that most women go through." Replying to another troll who tagged her in a video of a full local train, she wrote, "Uptil 1991, I travelled like this...also got physically harassed by nameless trolls like you."

129.title: Hyd Police asks Google to remove 221 loan apps over cheating complaints
129.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police have asked Google to remove 221 loan apps from its Play Store after receiving several complaints of harassment and cheating against such apps, Hyderabad Police tweeted on Saturday. Upon receiving the complaints, police said they launched an investigation against the apps and they were found to be illegal. Many were also found to be fake.

130.title: UP CM’s visit to Bhagya Laxmi Temple in Hyd postponed to Sunday: Report
130.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath's visit to the Bhagya Lakshmi Temple at Hyderabad's Charminar has been postponed till Sunday by the Telangana BJP over "important engagements". According to sources cited by The Siasat Daily, the IB has advised the UP CM against visiting the temple over the Nupur Sharma controversy. Yogi Adityanath was supposed to visit the temple on Saturday afternoon.

131.title: 3 arrested for selling bank accounts opened using fake documents in Mumbai
131.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested three cybercriminals who allegedly set up bank accounts using fake documents and sold these accounts to criminals for ₹10,000 each. Their module was busted during the investigation of a cybercrime case where a Mumbai resident lost ₹2 lakh, police said. Police seized 29 debit cards, seven mobile phones, 15 SIM cards and chequebooks from them.

132.title: Man kills brother over property dispute in Palghar, arrested
132.article_body: A 53-year-old man, Chindya Binder, was arrested for allegedly killing his younger brother, 51-year-old Ramesh Binder, over a property dispute in Maharashtra's Palghar, police said. The accused arrived at his brother's house, picked a quarrel with him and attacked him with a sharp weapon, killing him on the spot. Ramesh's body was sent to government hospital for post-mortem, police added.

133.title: 10-yr-old Licypriya shares pics of area around Taj Mahal before & after it was cleaned
133.article_body: Licypriya Kangujam, a 10-year-old climate activist, tweeted pictures of the area around Taj Mahal before and after it was cleaned. "Awesome to see the change and...initiative taken by you," a Twitter user commented. "Congratulations! You made a change," another comment read. "Behind the beauty of Taj Mahal is plastic pollution," she earlier wrote while sharing photo of the trash.

134.title: Is he Yuvi or Bumrah, reminded me of 2007: Sachin on Bumrah's world record
134.article_body: Reacting to Jasprit Bumrah slamming record 29 runs in an over by England pacer Stuart Broad in fifth Test, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Kya yeh Yuvi hai ya Bumrah!? 2007 ki yaad dilaa di. (Is he Yuvi or Bumrah...Reminded me of 2007)." Yuvraj Singh had slammed six sixes in an over bowled by Broad in a 2007 T20 World Cup match.

135.title: Video shows Stuart Broad bowling most expensive over in Test cricket history
135.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad on Saturday bowled the most expensive over in the history of Test cricket, against India in the rescheduled fifth Test. Broad conceded a total of 35 runs, out of which 29 were hit by India captain Jasprit Bumrah and the rest were extras. Broad's over read 4, 5(4+wide), 7(6+no-ball), 4, 4, 4, 6, 1.

136.title: Brother of former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains arrested in rape case
136.article_body: Ludhiana Police in Punjab has arrested Karamjit Singh Bains, brother of former Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains, in an alleged rape case of a 44-year-old woman. Simarjeet, along with his two brothers and four others, have already been declared proclaimed offenders in the case. As per reports, Simarjeet continues to be at large.

137.title: Broad now holds world record for bowling most expensive over in Tests and T20Is
137.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad now holds the world record for bowling the most expensive over in both Test and T20I cricket. Broad conceded 35 runs in an over against India in fifth Test on Saturday to concede most runs in an over in Test history. He had conceded 36 runs in an over against India in 2007 T20 World Cup.

138.title: B'luru Urban Dy Commissioner transferred after ACB questions him
138.article_body: The Karnataka government on Friday transferred Bengaluru Urban Deputy Commissioner J Manjunath, a day after the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) interrogated him in a corruption case. In May 2021, two of Manjunath's staff were arrested while allegedly receiving a ₹5 lakh bribe to get a favourable order from a court. He's now been made Director of the Integrated Child Protection Scheme.

139.title: Studying technical interventions to decongest traffic in B'luru: BBMP official
139.article_body: The Bengaluru civic body is studying technical interventions like automatic signalling and traffic movement at junctions, etc to help reduce congestion in the city, BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath said. "Automatic signalling is one thing suggested by the CM so that traffic can be smoothened," Nath said. Bengaluru has one of the highest traffic to population densities in India.

140.title: Swiatek reminds me a bit of Djokovic: Cornet ahead of 3rd round at Wimbledon
140.article_body: Ahead of her third round match against Iga Swiatek at Wimbledon, unseeded Frenchwoman Alize Cornet said the way the top seed moves and glides on the court reminds her a bit of Novak Djokovic. "I don't know "her ball" yet, I'm yet to discover it but I think she's very strong," she added. Swiatek is on a 37-match winning streak.

141.title: 40-year-old man shot dead outside his office in Delhi
141.article_body: A 40-year-old man was shot dead by unknown persons who opened fire on the victim outside his office in Paschim Vihar, police said on Saturday. Police said an investigation into the matter is in progress, adding that nine teams, including special staff, are working on the case. Meanwhile, police have recovered empty bullet cartridges from the spot.

142.title: Income Tax portal facing issues, Infosys has observed some irregular traffic: Govt
142.article_body: The government on Saturday said it has noticed that taxpayers are facing issues in accessing the Income Tax e-filing portal. "As informed by Infosys, they have observed some irregular traffic on the portal for which proactive measures are being taken," the Income Tax Department wrote on Twitter. The tax e-filing portal built by Infosys was launched on June 7, 2021.

143.title: 18-yr-old UP Dalit boy dies in explosion under cot; probe underway
143.article_body: An 18-year-old Dalit boy was recently killed in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow allegedly after an explosion took place under his cot while he was sleeping. The deceased's father, in his complaint, has said that two upper caste men killed his son over "enmity with the family". "We have four suspects as per the probe," ASP Hirdesh Katheriya said.

144.title: 14 more killed amid floods in Assam; death toll rises to 173
144.article_body: The death toll due to floods and landslides in Assam has risen to 173, according to Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA). This comes after 14 more people, including six children, died after drowning in flood waters in the state in the last 24 hours. Nearly 29.70 lakh people in 30 districts of the state have been affected by floods.

145.title: He is India's best Test batter at the moment: Jaffer on Pant's 111-ball 146
145.article_body: After Rishabh Pant hit 111-ball 146 in rescheduled fifth India-England Test in Edgbaston, Wasim Jaffer said the India wicketkeeper-batter is definitely the best Test batter at the moment. Pant, who scored the hundred in 89 balls, broke MS Dhoni's record for the fastest Test century by an Indian wicketkeeper-batter. Dhoni had smashed a 93-ball hundred against Pakistan in 2006.

146.title: Crowd attacks, tears clothes of Udaipur killing accused outside court; video surfaces
146.article_body: A video has shown a crowd attacking the men accused in Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's killing when they were presented before an NIA court in Jaipur on Saturday. The crowd is seen tearing the clothes of the accused men before police personnel put them in a van outside the court. All four accused were sent to a 10-day NIA remand.

147.title: Israel, Poland criticise Ukrainian envoy for defending WW2 nationalist
147.article_body: Ukraine's ambassador to Germany has been criticised by Israeli and Polish governments for his statement saying Ukrainian nationalist leader Stepan Bandera was not a "mass murderer of Poles and Jews". "The statement...belittles the Holocaust," the Israeli embassy stated. Bandera headed the radical wing of a Ukrainian nationalist group which killed tens of thousands of Poles during World War 2.

148.title: Blasts in Mykolaiv a day after 21 killed near Odesa in Ukraine
148.article_body: Explosions rocked the Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv on Saturday, said the city's mayor. "Stay in shelters!" the mayor warned city residents. This comes a day after at least 21 people were reportedly killed in an alleged Russian missile strike near Odesa. On Friday, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy termed the recent bombardment of Ukrainian cities as "conscious, deliberately targeted Russian terror".

149.title: Karthik criticises ECB over 'Root dismisses dominant Pant' headline for highlights
149.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik criticised England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) for 'Joe Root dismisses dominant Pant' headline of their YouTube video for highlights of Day 1 of the rescheduled fifth Test. Karthik wrote, "After such an engrossing, enthralling day's play, I'm sure the headline can be much better and apt than this." Pant slammed 146 runs off 111 deliveries.

150.title: Activist Teesta Setalvad, ex-Gujarat DGP sent to judicial custody
150.article_body: Activist Teesta Setalvad and former Gujarat DGP RB Sreekumar were on Sunday sent to judicial custody by a court in Ahmedabad. Earlier on June 26, the duo was sent to the Ahmedabad crime branch's custody for questioning till July 2. Their judicial custody will continue until bail is granted. So far, no bail application has been moved.

151.title: My character in 'Shamshera' is both funny, dangerous: Sanjay Dutt
151.article_body: Sanjay Dutt, while talking about his character Shuddh Singh in 'Shamshera', said that it's both funny and dangerous. "Audience should love him!" Sanjay said. "It's a character...you have never seen on screen...I loved the fact that Karan Malhotra created a villain like this and...thought of me to play this role," Sanjay had said earlier. 'Shamshera' also stars Ranbir Kapoor.

152.title: Salah signs new long-term Liverpool contract to extend Anfield stay
152.article_body: Mohamed Salah has signed a new long-term contract to extend his stay at Liverpool, the club announced on Friday. The forward was named FWA Footballer of the Year and PFA Players' Player of the Year for 2021-22 after helping Jürgen Klopp's side to a domestic cup double. Salah has scored 156 goals in 254 club appearances since arriving in 2017.

153.title: BJP's national executive meeting commences in Hyd; PM Modi present
153.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) two-day national executive meeting commenced in Hyderabad on Saturday. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP chief JP Nadda and other party leaders are present in the meeting. Earlier today, PM Modi took to Twitter and informed that a wide range of issues aimed at further strengthening the party will be discussed in the meeting.

154.title: Premarital sex, premarital pregnancy are matters of personal choice: Dia Mirza
154.article_body: Dia Mirza has said even though many are critical of premarital sex and premarital pregnancy, "there are enough people who recognise...it's a personal choice". "I feel when it comes to...personal choice, it can only be celebrated...by...those who ensure they make personal choices," she stated. "I don't think we're as progressive as we imagine...ourselves to be," Dia told Times of India.

155.title: CCTV video shows alleged killers of Amravati man who supported Nupur Sharma
155.article_body: CCTV footage has shown deceased chemist Umesh Kolhe being tailed by his alleged killers in Maharashtra's Amravati. Kolhe was stabbed to death on June 21 after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma. The footage was recorded between 10 pm and 10.30 pm when Kolhe was reportedly waylaid by the accused while he was returning home from his pharmacy.

156.title: Keep the flag high, proud of you: Harbhajan on Jadeja's ton in 5th Test
156.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to praise Ravindra Jadeja following the India all-rounder's century in the first innings of rescheduled fifth Test against England. "Jadeja, that's one of the best inn [innings]...what a 100...keep the flag high...Jadeja very proud of you," he wrote. Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Valuable hundred baapu. Batting at his peak of ability." Jadeja scored a 194-ball 104.

157.title: Audience didn't want to let go of my image after Mohabbatein: Preeti
157.article_body: Preeti Jhangiani, who made her Bollywood debut with Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Mohabbatein in 2000, said the audience had a certain image of her after the film which they didn't wanted to let go. "But...times have completely changed now, so I don't think that's an issue," she said, adding that she might return to acting if she gets an interesting role.

158.title: Father-son make video of married woman, blackmail her for money in Mysuru
158.article_body: Karnataka Police have booked father and son for allegedly blackmailing a married woman with her private video in Mysuru. The accused, who lived near the woman's house, allegedly recorded her video on phone while bathing and had been using it to blackmail her to extract money for the past two years. As per authorities, they also harassed her sexually.

159.title: Former Kerala MLA PC George arrested in sexual harassment case
159.article_body: Senior Kerala politician and former MLA PC George was on Saturday arrested on charges of sexually harassing a woman, who is also an accused in the solar panel case. George reportedly claimed that he was arrested as part of a conspiracy by CM Pinarayi Vijayan. The woman has alleged that George had invited her to the guest house in Thycaud.

160.title: 35,870 Russian soldiers killed, 1,582 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
160.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed around 35,870 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. As per Ukraine's Foreign Ministry, its forces have destroyed 1,582 Russian tanks and over 400 aircraft, including 186 helicopters. The ministry said that 3,737 armoured personnel carriers, 800 artillery systems and 246 multiple launch rocket systems have also been destroyed.

161.title: Messaged Świątek a couple of times as her gameplay has been crazy: Nadal
161.article_body: Talking about world number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek who's on a 37-match unbeaten run, Rafael Nadal said, "I've messaged [Iga] a couple of times because what she's playing is crazy." "The way she's able to keep her focus and winning spirit for so long is unbelievable...I'm quite happy that a girl like her is so successful," added Nadal.

162.title: My films get made, what can I do: Akshay on Madhavan's 40 day remark
162.article_body: On being asked about R Madhavan's comment on actors giving only 40-45 days to shoot a film, actor Akshay Kumar said, "My films get made, what can I do? It's not in my control that my films wrap up so fast." The actor further said, "If a director...tells me my work is done, go home, should I fight with him?"

163.title: Husband is very supportive of my political career, it has shocked me: Urmila
163.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar said in an interview that her husband, Mohsin Akhtar, has been "so extremely supportive" of her political career that it has shocked her. "He has given me more strength to speak my mind out, the way I have been speaking," Urmila said, adding, "After being...a blessed daughter, I am a blessed wife and a daughter-in-law."

164.title: Root knows DNA of Test cricket; that's what makes him great: Chopra
164.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that English batter Joe Root knows the "DNA of Test cricket" and that makes him "great". "Root likes to cut the ball or use the backfoot punch or pull and knows how to build his innings," Chopra said. "There is a very small window of opportunity to get Root out," he added.

165.title: PM Modi has not actually understand MGNREGA: Rahul Gandhi
165.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was "shocked" when PM Narendra Modi spoke against the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) in Lok Sabha. "PM called [MGNREGA] a living monument of the failures of the UPA," Gandhi said. "It made me realise that the PM actually had not understood the depth of MGNREGA," he added.

166.title: Woman kills 3-yr-old daughter before dying by suicide in Bengaluru
166.article_body: A 31-year-old woman allegedly killed her 3-year-old daughter and later died by suicide at her apartment in Bengaluru's RR Nagar on Thursday. According to police, the deceased was depressed over her health issues. Her husband who works as a software engineer also lived with them in the apartment. An investigation is underway to ascertain whether the couple had marital problems.

167.title: Taron Egerton confirms meeting Marvel chief for Wolverine role
167.article_body: Actor Taron Egerton in an interview with The New York Times confirmed that he has been in talks with Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige and other executives about taking on the role of Wolverine, previously played by Hugh Jackman. "Hopefully if it does come around, they'll give me a shot," the 'Rocketman' actor added.

168.title: Nikki tests COVID positive for 2nd time, says couldn't breathe at one point
168.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has tested positive for COVID-19. The actress stated that she initially neglected the symptoms assuming it to be a change in weather. "However, when I was coming back to Mumbai in...flight, I just couldn't breathe at one point," Nikki added. Notably, this is the second time that Nikki has tested positive for the virus.

169.title: Got to win overseas Tests to become world number 1: Pat Cummins
169.article_body: After winning the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle, Australian skipper Pat Cummins said that one needs to win overseas Tests to be the world's "number one" team. "...Mitchell Starc working on the reverse swing, Nathan Lyon coming up with a few new balls. There is so much to learn and be successful on these (Lankan) wickets," Cummins said.

170.title: Elon Musk tweets tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who died from cancer at 23
170.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted a tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who passed away due to stage four cancer on July 1. "Cancer is an absurd piece of literal garbage and death," the image shared by Musk read. Technoblade, whose real name was revealed as Alex after his death, had more than 12 million subscribers on YouTube.

171.title: 'Zubair's bail plea order leaked by Delhi DCP', says his lawyer; officer clarifies
171.article_body: After reports claimed that the bail plea of fact-checker Mohammed Zubair was rejected by a Delhi court, Zubair's lawyer said the order was "leaked" to the media by Delhi DCP KPS Malhotra. Advocate Soutik Banerjee said the judge has reserved the matter for judgment and called Malhotra's actions "scandalous". Malhotra clarified that he "misheard" the order that was "inadvertently" broadcast.

172.title: Terrible feeling to be in opposing box against Novak: Ex-coach Vajda
172.article_body: Novak Djokovic's former coach Marian Vajda, who coached the tennis player for 15 years, said it was "very strange to be in the opposing box" against Djokovic during a French Open 2022 match. Tennis player Alex Molcan, who's being coached by Vajda, played against Djokovic in the second round. "It was a terrible feeling...Novak...also felt very bad," stated Vajda.
