173.title: 91-yr-old billionaire Rupert Murdoch's 4th wife Jerry files for divorce after 6 yrs
173.article_body: Model Jerry Hall has filed for divorce from media tycoon Rupert Murdoch after six years of marriage. Hall has cited "irreconcilable differences" between her and Murdoch, and sought unspecified spousal support from the 91-year-old billionaire. This will be the fourth divorce for Murdoch. The 66-year-old model was previously the long-term partner of The Rolling Stones' lead vocalist Mick Jagger.

174.title: Do something honourable about your honour: Anupam on SC's statement on Nupur
174.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher reacted to the Supreme Court's statement on former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, tweeting, "Your Honour! Do something honourable about your HONOUR!" The Supreme Court had stated, "She has a threat or she has become a security threat?...This lady is single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country. We saw the debate."

175.title: HIV speeds up body’s ageing process soon after infection: Study
175.article_body: HIV has an early and substantial impact on the process of ageing, a study has found. Highlighting the need for early diagnosis of the infection, the study stated that HIV can start impacting ageing within just two to three years of contracting the virus. Moreover, HIV may rapidly cut about five years off an individual's life span, it stated.

176.title: Govt grants financial help to families of 35 deceased journalists
176.article_body: The central government has approved a proposal of the Journalist Welfare Scheme Committee to provide financial relief of ₹5 lakh to the families of 35 deceased journalists, including those who died due to COVID-19. The committee has also recommended assistance to two journalists suffering from permanent disability. The committee has approved a total assistance of ₹1.81 crore during a meeting.

177.title: Gambia bans all timber exports to combat rosewood smuggling
177.article_body: The Gambia on Friday banned timber exports and revoked all timber export licences to combat the illegal smuggling of endangered rosewood. The government has also instructed port authorities to oversee and prevent any loading of logs onto any vessels. The West African nation has exported an estimated 1.6 million rosewood trees since 2012, according to the Environmental Investigation Agency.

178.title: Shoes, jackets, ornaments barred for Himachal police re-exam after paper leak
178.article_body: Following the paper leak of the written test held in March to recruit Himachal Pradesh Police constables, examinees taking the re-examination on Sunday have been prohibited from wearing jackets and metal ornaments in the examination hall. The examinees also have been asked to wear slippers and flip-flops, instead of socks and shoes. They have been barred from carrying electronic devices.

179.title: Priyanka's brand criticised for being overpriced, people point out tablecloth worth ₹30,000
179.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, who recently launched her homeware brand SONA Home, has been called out for keeping the prices of the items 'exorbitantly high'. "I wanna be rich to a point where I can casually buy a SONA Home tablecloth worth ₹30,000," a tweet read. "Whitewashed millionaire Indian selling overpriced bulls**t to goras as 'exotic' Indian designs," another person commented.

180.title: Ranveer Singh made Alauddin Khilji in Padmaavat look 'terrifying': Ranbir
180.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent video shared by Yash Raj Films, praised actors who have essayed negative roles in films. "In Padmaavat, Ranveer...made Alauddin Khilji so terrifying, that even after...film ends, the character stays with you," Ranbir said. He also called Shah Rukh Khan's role in 'Darr' the "most iconic". "My dream is to play a negative role," Ranbir added.

181.title: I would've been fined 15,000 pounds: Kyrgios on Bublik's underarm serves
181.article_body: Discussing tennis player Alexander Bublik's six underarm serves in his third round match of Wimbledon 2022, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios tweeted, "If it was me, I [would've been]...fined a minimum of 15,000 pounds." Kyrgios added he would have also been "accused of tanking". Kyrgios was recently seen spitting in the direction of an abusive spectator during a Wimbledon match.

182.title: Single-use plastic ban good, but alternatives are costly: Traders
182.article_body: As single-use plastic  (SUP) items have been banned in India, Delhi traders selling these items said alternatives to SUPs are few and costly. Delhi-based Rajeev Sahni, who runs a shop selling disposables, said, "The ban...is good. But we need easily available [and] pocket-friendly alternatives." "Customers are running away now since prices of (alternatives to SUPs) have risen," a wholesaler said.

183.title: Delhi Police constable kills self with service pistol; body found in car
183.article_body: A Delhi Police constable allegedly shot himself dead with his service revolver in Prashant Vihar, Delhi. The deceased, Amandeep Singh, was posted at the Prashant Vihar Police Station and was on casual leaves. The deceased's body was found lying inside a car parked near a petrol pump, police said. Notably, the body has been sent for post-mortem, police added.

184.title: Jasprit Bumrah breaks world record for scoring most runs in an over in a Test match
184.article_body: India captain Jasprit Bumrah on Saturday broke the world record for scoring the most runs in an over in a Test. The 28-year-old scored 29 runs off Stuart Broad's over in first innings of rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston. Bumrah slammed four fours and two sixes, and took a single. Broad conceded 35 runs in the over, including six extras.

185.title: Dad told me my films are good but they won't make me a national star: Ranbir
185.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed that his father, Rishi Kapoor, would tell him that the kind of films he does are good but they won't make him a "national star". "Now I understand...what he was trying to say," he added. Ranbir further said he always looks at his favourite heroes "from a low angle", adding, "I never see them as...equal to me."

186.title: PM Modi govt spends 6 times more on railways in Gujarat than UPA: Shah
186.article_body: Addressing a gathering in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that PM Narendra Modi-led Central government spends six times more money annually on railways in Gujarat than the previous UPA government. "UPA used to spend ₹590 crore every year on the railways in Gujarat. PM Modi increased this spending to ₹3,960 crore between 2014 and 2022," Shah added.

187.title: Modi govt is successfully killing democracy everyday: Telangana CM
187.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has accused the BJP-led Centre of "killing" democracy. "What the Modi administration is doing is successfully killing democracy everyday, throttling the federal system...toppling governments which do not toe their line," CM Rao said. "PM Modi is the 15th PM...and in terms of the last 14 PMs, never has India's image been affected," he added.

188.title: Bulgaria destroys Soviet-era naval mine off its Black Sea coast
188.article_body: Bulgaria's Defence Ministry said its military has carried out a controlled explosion of a Soviet-era naval mine that had drifted close to the country's Black Sea coast. The mine was first spotted by a motor ship, it added. Black Sea countries began to report the appearance of such mines floating in the sea after Russia began invading Ukraine in February.

189.title: India score 35 runs as Stuart Broad bowls most expensive over in Test cricket history
189.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad on Saturday bowled the most expensive over in Test history after India aggregated 35 runs from his 18th over in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test. India captain Jasprit Bumrah scored 29 runs off the over, while the remaining runs came off extras.  The previous most expensive over in Test history went for 28 runs.

190.title: BJP denies link to Udaipur killing accused as pics of him with local leaders emerge
190.article_body: After several pictures showing Udaipur killing accused Riyaz Akhtari with members of the Rajasthan BJP surfaced online, the party denied having any links with him. "Anyone can have a photo with any leader. It doesn't mean that he's a member," said Rajasthan's BJP Minority Morcha chief Mohammad Sadiq Khan. An India Today report said Akhtari had attended BJP events.

191.title: Heavy jewellery in 'Chamma Chamma' could have got me hospitalised: Urmila
191.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar, while talking about her song 'Chamma Chamma', recalled how director Rajkumar Santoshi told her to reduce the jewellery she was wearing as they were too heavy for dancing. The actress said that she refused and was later hit by the ornaments during the shoot. "By...end of those four days, I could've been hospitalised from all...scratches," she added.

192.title: Haven't seen him on set: Mandar on reports of Raj Anadkat quitting 'Taarak...'
192.article_body: Actor Mandar Chandwadkar, who plays Bhide on 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has reacted to reports claiming actor Raj Anadkat has quit the show. "As artists, we don't know if he has quit...but he'd some health issues due to which he hasn't been shooting for...past few days. I haven't seen him on...set," he said. Raj plays Tapu on the show.

193.title: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia opens 1.2 km km-long Benito Juarez Marg underpass
193.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday inaugurated the 1.2 km-long Y-shaped Benito Juarez Marg underpass. The underpass starts at the Delhi Metro's Durgabai Deshmukh South Campus station and connects the South Campus to AIIMS and Moti Bagh. "Adding to the economic value of saving time, this underpass will save ₹18 crore for Delhiites every year," Sisodia tweeted.

194.title: Govt warns edtech firms against unfair trade practices, misleading ads
194.article_body: The Central government has warned edtech companies against unfair trade practices and said that if self-regulation doesn't curb such practices, stringent guidelines will be formulated. Consumer Affairs Secretary Rohit Kumar Singh flagged concerns over misleading ads and increasing fake reviews. Notably, the education category was the largest violator of advertising code in 2021-22, as per ASCI.

195.title: Viruses make people more attractive to mosquitoes: Study
195.article_body: Mosquitoes choose their target on basis of people's body temperature, odour and CO2 from their breath. Some viruses alter body odour in a way that makes people more attractive to mosquitoes, a study stated. They can also transfer the virus from an infected person to another person through bites. Researchers also found that mosquitoes are more attracted to acetophenone's odour.

196.title: Delhi court rejects Zubair's bail plea, sends him to 14-day judicial custody
196.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday rejected Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair's bail plea and sent him to a 14-day judicial custody in a case related to an "objectionable" tweet he had posted in 2018. Delhi Police produced Zubair before the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate and sought a 14-day custody after seizing his mobile phone and recovering a hard disk during investigation.

197.title: Anand Mahindra shares pics from Pant's knock against England, says 'Test cricket tandav'
197.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a collage of pictures from Rishabh Pant's 146-run knock against England in the rescheduled fifth Test. "Test cricket tandav. Rishabh Pant is a sports artiste. Impossible not to marvel at him," Mahindra wrote alongside the collage. Rishabh recorded the fastest Test hundred by a Team India wicketkeeper off 89 deliveries.

198.title: Mithali shares letter PM Modi wrote on her retirement, says 'I'll treasure this forever'
198.article_body: Former India Women captain Mithali Raj took to Twitter to share a letter PM Modi wrote to her while congratulating her on her retirement. "It’s a matter of singular honour & pride when one receives such warm encouragement from our Hon'ble PM Shri Narendra Modi ji," she wrote. She added, "I will treasure this forever."

199.title: Smashed glass on face to get audience's attention: Machine Gun Kelly
199.article_body: Speaking about smashing a champagne glass on his face mid-concert in New York, singer Machine Gun Kelly said he did it to get the audience's attention. "You know when you clink a champagne glass with a fork to kind of [get people's attention]? Yeah, well, I didn't have a fork. So I just clinked it on my head," he said.

200.title: Sania Mirza and Mate Pavic enter 2nd round of Wimbledon mixed doubles
200.article_body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza, who is making her final Wimbledon appearance, and Mate Pavic have entered mixed doubles second round after a win over David Vega Hernandez and Natela Dzalamidze on Friday. The sixth seeds defeated the unseeded pair 6-4, 3-6, 7-6(10-3) on Friday. Sania has already announced her retirement at the end of this season.

201.title: 3 bike-borne men killed after being hit by vehicle in UP's Firozabad
201.article_body: Three men travelling on a motorcycle were killed after being hit by a vehicle in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad district on Friday. The deceased, identified as Jaicharan (25), Ganesh (23) and Narendra (24), were travelling to Delhi from Banda before being hit by the unidentified vehicle. Two of them were from Banda while the remaining one was from Sultanpur, police said.

202.title: Naming colonies after PM, Chief Minister in Bihar unethical: RJD leader
202.article_body: RJD leader Shivanand Tiwary on Friday criticised the proposal to name residential colonies for the homeless in Bihar after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. "To name a scheme that uses public funds after a living person...would be unethical," he said. "It should be named after any luminary from our state with an underprivileged background," Tiwary suggested.

203.title: B'luru police clear road after complaint on 'autos parked haphazardly'
203.article_body: Bengaluru's HAL Airport Traffic police tweeted on Friday that they have cleared the road and put a 'no parking' sign after a Twitter user complained about many autos parked "haphazardly" on the Suranjan Das road. The Twitter user had tagged Bengaluru City Traffic police and said, "[Is] this a designated auto stand?... Why are you not taking this seriously?"

204.title: Thousands rally in Australia against overturning of US abortion law
204.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets of Australia on Saturday to rally against the US Supreme Court's decision to overturn a ruling that legalised abortion. Protesters were seen holding placards that read "Hands off my uterus" and "I'll not quietly go back to the 1950s". "Abortion is healthcare and every woman deserves a right to that," a protester said.

205.title: Ravindra Jadeja smashes his first international hundred outside India
205.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja on Saturday completed his first-ever overseas hundred in international cricket. The 33-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 183 deliveries in India's first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test against England at Edgbaston. Overall, it is Jadeja's third hundred in Test cricket. Jadeja's first two hundreds had come in Rajkot and Mohali.

206.title: Judge asked dad if he's okay if I don't get married after adoption: Sushmita
206.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen has revealed that during the adoption hearing for her first daughter Renee, the judge asked her father if he is okay with her decision because it would affect her marriage plans. The actress said that her father stated he had never raised Sushmita to only be someone's wife. Sushmita added that she was sobbing during the hearing.

207.title: PMC extends deadline for regularisation of illegal homes
207.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has extended the deadline for regularisation of illegal homes made on small plots under the Gunthewari scheme till March 31, 2023. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar urged citizens to take benefit of the scheme, under which unauthorised small plots can reportedly have legal construction for 20 years. Notably, the deadline has been extended for the fourth time.

208.title: Musk breaks his 9-day silence on Twitter, shares pic of him and his kids with Pope
208.article_body: Elon Musk broke his nine-day silence on Twitter, the social media platform he is trying to buy for $44 billion, by posting a picture of him meeting Pope Francis. The world's richest person tweeted, "Honored to meet the Pope yesterday." Musk's four teenage boys can also be seen in the picture.

209.title: It felt like a new journey started: Aditya on transition from TV to films
209.article_body: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur, who worked as a VJ (video jockey) on a music channel before entering Bollywood, called his transition from TV to films "seamless". "When I did get into film, it just felt like a new journey started," he added. The actor, who also hosted a TV show, called the television audience "very different" from that of films.

210.title: Every day at least 1 or 2 Afghan women die by suicide: Ex-Dy Speaker
210.article_body: Former Deputy Speaker of the Afghan Parliament Fawzia Koofi told Human Rights Council that every day at least one or two women die by suicide "due to...lack of opportunity and mental health pressures" in Afghanistan. "Girls as young as nine...are being sold, not only because of economic pressure but because...there's no hope for them, for their family," she added.

211.title: Southwest Monsoon covers entire country six days before normal date
211.article_body: The Southwest Monsoon has already covered the whole of India as of Saturday, said the latest India Meteorological Department (IMD) bulletin. The monsoon has advanced into the remaining parts of the North Arabian Sea, Gujarat and Rajasthan on July 2, six days earlier than the expected date. This comes as widespread rains continued in several parts of India.

212.title: Brave ball by Root to dismiss Pant who batted out of his skin: Collingwood
212.article_body: England assistant coach Paul Collingwood said Rishabh Pant batted out of his skin during his 146 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England. "It was a brave ball from Joe Root [to dismiss Pant]...but sometimes you need a bit of genius," he added. "When you watch someone as exciting as Pant, you've got to applaud," stated Collingwood.

213.title: Delhi likely to receive rainfall throughout the upcoming week: IMD
213.article_body: IMD has predicted that Delhi is expected to receive rains during the upcoming week (July 2-8). According to IMD, light rainfall is likely in the city on Saturday, Sunday and Monday, while heavy showers are expected on Wednesday. The maximum temperature is likely to range from 32-36°C, while the minimum temperature could range between 24-27°C over the next six days.

214.title: Govt orders NIA probe in killing of Amravati man who supported Nupur Sharma
214.article_body: The government has handed over the investigation into the June 21 killing of Maharashtra man Umesh Kolhe to the NIA. Amravati's Kolhe was stabbed to death after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police said. "The conspiracy behind the killing, involvement of organisations, international linkages would be thoroughly investigated," said Home Minister's Office.

215.title: I was starstruck when I met Amitabh Bachchan: Madhuri Dixit
215.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has revealed that the first time she ever got starstruck on set was when she met veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan. The actress added that she got a little tongue-tied when she met him. Madhuri made a special appearance in the song 'Makhna' in 1998 film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' which also stars Govinda and Raveena Tandon.

216.title: Delhi man fakes robbery to use wife's money to clear debts; booked
216.article_body: Delhi Police have booked a man who allegedly made a fake robbery story of ₹2 lakh in a bid to use his wife's money to pay off his debts. Police investigation revealed the accused had incurred heavy losses during the COVID-19 pandemic and was in debt. Meanwhile, police have recovered the amount, which he had kept hidden in his car.

217.title: He was a new director: Mukesh on paying ₹7 lakh to Basu for 'Saaya' & 'Murder'
217.article_body: Producer Mukesh Bhatt has reacted to filmmaker Anurag Basu's old statement wherein he stated that he was paid just ₹7 lakh to direct both 'Saaya' and 'Murder'. Mukesh said, "He was a new director." He added, "Moreover, John Abraham was also a newcomer...So, for a film (Saaya) comprising a newcomer and a new director, what recovery can you expect?"

218.title: 6 students from Pune win national competition on rural innovation
218.article_body: A team of six students from Pune's Sanskriti School has won a national competition on rural innovation. As part of 'Future Entrepreneurs 2021', the students have designed a farmer-friendly product based on the theme of rural ecosystem. "The product we have innovated can help to clean cattle in 10-15 minutes with longer brushes which are automated," one of them said.

219.title: ₹1.65 crore modular operation theatre inaugurated at Pune hospital
219.article_body: A state-of-the-art modular operation theatre built for ₹1.65 crore was inaugurated at Pune's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Cantonment General Hospital on Friday. The operation theatre was funded under corporate social responsibility. The Pune Cantonment Board's CEO Subrat Pal thanked people for their financial assistance and said that the hospital will continue to provide good service in the future.

220.title: China's Great Wall Motors drops $1 bn India entry plan, reportedly fires staff
220.article_body: Chinese carmaker Great Wall Motors has abandoned its $1-billion plan to enter the Indian market. The development comes after the company failed to get the government's approval to acquire General Motors' Talegaon plant near Pune after waiting for two and a half years. The company has shut its India office and terminated its team of 8-10 employees, as per reports.

221.title: Man stabbed to death after sharing WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma in Maha
221.article_body: A man named Umesh Kolhe was stabbed to death in Maharashtra's Amravati on June 21 after he shared a post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma on some WhatsApp groups, police said. At least five people have been arrested for the 54-year-old's murder. The incident took place a week before Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal was beheaded for supporting Sharma.

222.title: Scared to go on pothole-filled, chaotic Mumbai roads: Hema Malini
222.article_body: Actress-turned-politician Hema Malini spoke about the roads of Mumbai, saying that she is scared to go on them due to the traffic and chaos. "I just can't imagine how a pregnant woman must be travelling on these roads that are full of potholes," she added. Hema further said that places like Delhi and Mathura have traffic but it is streamlined.

223.title: Don't know how he's out of form for so long: Manjrekar on Kohli's dismissal
223.article_body: Sanjay Manjrekar said he "doesn't know" how Virat Kohli's been out of form for "so long" having been dismissed for 11 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England. "When great batters go out of form, they come back in form quickly," added Manjrekar. "The confidence has gone down...he's enduring...bad luck, also there are technical issues," he stated.

224.title: Delhi woman slips from stairs, dies as mangalsutra slits her throat
224.article_body: A 22-year-old woman died after allegedly falling from the stairs in her house in Delhi. Police said, prima facie, the injuries suggest that her mangalsutra got entangled around her neck and slit her throat. "Her four-year-old son was with her...He told the police that his mother had gone to the terrace to put clothes to dry," an officer said.

225.title: Another landslide hits Manipur as death toll from previous one rises to 24
225.article_body: The death toll due to the landslide at Tupul in Manipur's Noney has risen to 24, officials said. Notably, another landslide hit the state on Saturday at a construction site in Noney. The first landslide occurred on Wednesday where a company of the 107 Territorial Army (TA) was deployed at a construction site near the Tupul yard railway construction site.

226.title: Want to uplift people through infra development: Droupadi Murmu
226.article_body: While addressing a function in Himachal Pradesh's Baddi on Friday, NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu said she wants to uplift people through infrastructure development at the grassroots level. She also praised Himachal for "showing the way to the country in various parameters of development". Supporting Murmu, CM Jai Ram Thakur said that her victory in the Presidential poll is certain.

227.title: 52-yr-old woman trampled to death by an elephant in Chhattisgarh
227.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was trampled to death by an elephant in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur on Thursday night, a forest official said. "An elephant entered the house of Gurbari Bai and killed her while she was asleep. The tusker reportedly reached the village from the Jharkhand border," the official said. Financial aid of ₹25,000 was given to the family members, he added.

228.title: Pune to receive light showers for next few days: IMD
228.article_body: After light rainfall was reported in Pune on Friday, the India Meteorological Department has said that the light showers are going to continue for the next few days in the district. "There are packed isobars due to the presence of offshore trough and strong westerlies...[Therefore,] rainfall is likely to continue," an official said. Notably, Lavale recorded 7 mm rainfall yesterday.

229.title: Cost of electric vehicles should be affordable for common man: Bommai
229.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday appealed to the automobile manufacturers to focus on making electric vehicles which are affordable for the common man. "Then only its usage could see an increase," Bommai said. After inaugurating 152 EV charging stations in Bengaluru, he said, "The state government has decided to induct more EV buses into Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC)."

230.title: Will she dump Yashwant?: Malviya after Mamata's remarks on Murmu
230.article_body: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she could've considered NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu as a consensus candidate, BJP leader Amit Malviya said, "Will she dump [Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha]?" He also claimed that Mamata has realised that her anti-tribal and anti-woman position is "untenable". "Murmu is more likely to win...polls," Mamata had said.

231.title: Only 30% in 12-15 yrs group received 2nd COVID dose in Pune: Health dept
231.article_body: Around 29.62% of beneficiaries in the 12-15 years age group have received their second COVID dose in Pune. According to the state health department, around 55.21% of the beneficiaries have received their first COVID dose. However, Pune's numbers are lagging behind the state's average figures which are at 60.1% for the first dose and 31.01% for second dose beneficiaries.

232.title: I have no idea why Jayeshbhai Jordaar didn't work: Boman Irani
232.article_body: Boman Irani, speaking about the underwhelming performance of 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' at the box office, said, "I've no idea why [it] didn't work...and I don't want to analyse it too." He added that the intention of the film was very good. Boman further said 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' was a great experience, and he loved what director Divyang Thakkar was trying to say.

233.title: 4 houses collapse in Mumbai's Chunabhatti, no casualties reported
233.article_body: Amid heavy rains, four houses collapsed in Mumbai's Chunabhatti area on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. No casualties or injuries were reported from the incident. This comes after a portion of a 100-year-old building in Mumbai's Kalbadevi collapsed on Thursday. Another such incident was reported in Sion where a portion of ground-plus-five structures fell.

234.title: US truck driver who thought he won ₹1.5 lakh lottery, hits ₹7.5 cr jackpot
234.article_body: A truck driver in the US hit a jackpot of $1 million (₹7.5 crore) on a lottery ticket he initially thought had $2,000 (₹1.5 lakh) prize. "I didn't believe it was real until I called the lottery office to confirm my prize," the driver said. The driver plans to buy a new vehicle with the money and save the rest.

235.title: Karate champ Amritpal dedicates gold medal to Sonu Sood for helping with her surgery
235.article_body: Karate champion Amritpal Kaur dedicated her All India Karate Championship gold medal to Sonu Sood, who had helped with her knee surgery two years ago. "Sonu sir came to my aid when I was at my lowest," she wrote. The actor also shared pictures, writing, "When you see...positive impact you've had in other's lives...it makes your life even more worthwhile."

236.title: Edibles containing drug responsible for effects of marijuana legalised in Minnesota
236.article_body: A new Minnesota law allowing people 21 and older to buy edibles and beverages containing THC, the substance responsible for effects of marijuana on a person's mental state, has come into effect. Edibles and beverages can contain up to 5 milligrams of THC per serving and 50 milligrams per package. "This stuff will get you high," a lawyer said.

237.title: Rakul plays golf with Kapil Dev & Sadhguru in Washington DC, shares video
237.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh took to Instagram to share a video of her playing golf with Kapil Dev and Sadhguru. "What better than kickstarting ATA convention at Washington DC with @sadhguru @therealkapildev," she wrote. Reacting to Rakul's post, a fan wrote, "Amazing." Rakul, who was recently seen in 'Runway 34', will next be seen alongside Ayushmann Khurrana in 'Doctor G'.

238.title: Dinesh Karthik captains India in T20 practice match against Derbyshire, fans react
238.article_body: Dinesh Karthik, who is the senior-most member of India's current T20I squad, captained the team against Derbyshire in a T20 practice match on Friday. "Honestly speaking, I never imagined I will see Karthik leading Team India...in my lifetime. Though it's a mere practice match," a fan tweeted. "So so happy to see you in the captaincy role," wrote another.

239.title: He looked composed; unlucky to get out like that: Swann on Kohli
239.article_body: Former English spinner Graeme Swann said that the way Indian batter Virat Kohli was dismissed on Day 1 of the fifth Test was "quite unlucky" for the former Indian skipper. "Kohli looked really composed out there...if you see his legs, he was trying to get outside the off-stump...He looked devastated when he got out...as he wanted it today," Swann said.

240.title: I don't play in same manner so that bowler gets mentally disturbed: Pant
240.article_body: Following his 146 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England, Rishabh Pant said, "I keep trying that I don't play in the same manner so that the bowler gets mentally disturbed." "Especially in conditions like England where...the bowler is bowling well...it becomes important to disturb his...line and length," added Pant. Pant had a strike rate of 131.53.

241.title: Don't forget to enjoy our Dum Biryani: KTR to BJP ahead of Hyd meet
241.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday took to Twitter to mock BJP ahead of its national executive meet in Hyderabad, saying, "To all the Jhumla Jeevis; Don’t forget to enjoy our Dum Biryani and Irani Chai." He also called the BJP a "WhatsApp University". "Please visit, take notes and try to implement in your states," he added.

242.title: California to end arrests for loitering for prostitution
242.article_body: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed a new state law that will stop police from arresting people for loitering for prostitution. "To be clear, this bill doesn't legalise prostitution," Newsom said. "It simply revokes provisions of the law that have led to disproportionate harassment of women" and transgender adults, he added, noting that Black and Latino women are particularly affected.

243.title: Footpath cracks open following landslide in Mumbai's Peddar Road area
243.article_body: Continuous rainfall in South Mumbai triggered a landslide on Thursday midnight near an under-construction building in the Tony Peddar Road area of Mumbai. The landslide resulted in the footpath along the stretch to crack wide open. According to BMC officials, no casualties were reported as there was no one on the footpath at the time of the incident.

244.title: NIA court convicts 5 members of banned outfit SIMI in Bijnor blast case
244.article_body: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has convicted five members of the banned outfit SIMI in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor blast case. The convicts have been sentenced to rigorous imprisonment from three years to a maximum of seven years and 10 months for various offences. The case relates to an explosion that took place in a house in Bijnor in 2014.

245.title: Harassed by moneylenders, family of 3 jump in canal & die in Punjab
245.article_body: A couple and their 10-year-old son allegedly jumped into the Kotla branch canal and died over harassment by moneylenders and due to their poor financial conditions in Punjab's Mansa. Two of the bodies have been recovered from the canal so far, an investigating officer said. The police also found a purported suicide note written on the son's notebook.

246.title: Had no plan to play at Wimbledon; saw grass, got excited: Venus
246.article_body: Former Grand Slam champion Venus Williams made a comeback at Wimbledon after being away from the court for almost a year. The 42-year-old American and her British partner Jamie Murray secured a win in their first round of the mixed-doubles event on Friday. "I had no plan to play (at Wimbledon). I saw the grass and got excited," Venus said.

247.title: 2 minor boys engaged in child labour rescued in Hyderabad
247.article_body: The SHE Teams of Rachakonda Police along with Operation Muskan Team on Friday rescued two minor boys engaged in child labour in Hyderabad. The boys belong to Bihar and were working at a service centre at Bandlaguda, under the limits of LB Nagar police station, Rachakonda Police said. The police also counselled their guardian about the Child Labour Act.

248.title: Jadeja's 83* was equally important as Pant's 146: Giles on Day 1
248.article_body: Ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said Ravindra Jadeja's 83* on Day 1 of the fifth Test against England was almost as important as Rishabh Pant's 146. "Someone had to be [the] anchor to allow Pant to play that way," added Giles. Jadeja and Pant stitched a record sixth-wicket partnership of 222 runs, helping India rebuild after being reduced to 98/5.

249.title: It's my duty to appear if ED summons me, can come again: Sanjay Raut
249.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said as a responsible citizen and Member of Parliament, it's his duty to appear if an investigative agency summons him. "Problem is with timing amid Maharashtra political crisis but they had doubts. Told them...I can come again if need be," Raut added. ED questioned Raut for 10 hours on Friday in a money laundering case.

250.title: Refused food on credit, man throws acid at sweet shop; 7 injured
250.article_body: Seven people were injured after a man allegedly threw acid at a sweetmeat stall in Haripur village of Jharkhand. According to police, after the shop owner refused to give him food on credit, the accused went home, returned with acid and threw it inside the shop. The injured people were taken to a local hospital.

251.title: India's largest floating solar power project fully operational in T'gana, pics released
251.article_body: India's largest floating solar power project is now fully operational, the government announced. The NTPC declared commercial operation of the final part capacity of 20 MW out of 100 MW Ramagundam Floating Solar PV Project at Ramagundam, Telangana with effect from July 1. The project spreads over 500 acres and is divided into 40 blocks.

252.title: Giant snail that can cause meningitis spotted in US county; quarantine ordered
252.article_body: A giant African land snail has been spotted in a Florida county, sending the area into quarantine. Giant African land snails can carry a parasite called rat lungworm, known to cause meningitis in humans and livestock, according to US Department of Agriculture. The snails can reach almost 8 inches long and 5 inches in diameter, the organisation said.

253.title: Entire budget of 'Shabaash Mithu' is equivalent to an A-lister's salary: Taapsee Pannu
253.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, in a recent interview, said that 'Shabaash Mithu' is her biggest budget film. She, however, added that the entire budget of the film is still equivalent to an A-lister's salary. "The situation is still like that. So, there is still a long way for us to go," she further stated, referring to pay disparity in Bollywood.

254.title: I was also offered to join rebel MLAs in Guwahati: Sena's Sanjay Raut
254.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that he was also offered to join the rebel MLAs in Guwahati. "I also got an offer for Guwahati but I follow Balasaheb Thackeray...so I didn't go there," he added. "When the truth is on your side, why fear?" Raut stated. Eknath Shinde, who was leading the rebel MLAs, became the new Maharashtra CM.

255.title: There is problem now: Chopra on Pujara being dismissed for 13(46)
255.article_body: After India batter Cheteshwar Pujara got dismissed for 13(46) in the fifth Test against England, former India cricketer Aakash Chopra said that "there is a problem now". "Pujara was going slowly-slowly, standing at one end...But the knock didn't last long. He again fell victim to James Anderson," Chopra said. He added, "Pujara is not getting his preferred No. 3 spot."

256.title: Can't get better than this: Ganguly on Pant-Jadeja's record stand
256.article_body: Reacting to the record sixth-wicket partnership of 222 runs between Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja in India's first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England, Sourav Ganguly tweeted, "Can't get better than this." "Special exhibition of Test match batting under pressure," he added. Sachin Tendulkar tweeted that Pant's 146 was "simply awesome", adding Jadeja played "amazing shots".

257.title: I hope both 'Raksha...' & 'Laal Singh...' do well at box office: Akshay
257.article_body: Akshay Kumar has opened up about the box office clash between his upcoming movie 'Raksha Bandhan' and Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "My film Welcome and his film Taare Zameen Par were released simultaneously. Both had done well. We are hoping that both...do well at the box office," he said. Both the films are scheduled to release on August 11.

258.title: Alt News' Zubair destroyed evidence, received donations from foreign nations: Police
258.article_body: The Delhi Police has added charges of criminal conspiracy and destruction of evidence in the case against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. The police also said that the accused received donations from foreign countries. "It was noticed that Twitter handles supporting Zubair after his arrest, were from Pakistan and mostly middle eastern countries," the police added.

259.title: Ukrainian borscht soup added to UNESCO endangered heritage list
259.article_body: UNESCO has added the cooking of Ukrainian borscht, a soup made of beetroot and other vegetables, to its list of endangered cultural traditions. The war in Ukraine has "threatened" the cooking of borscht, UNESCO said. Moscow decried the new protected Ukrainian status of the dish, which is also popular in Russia, saying the Russian version of borscht "doesn't need protection".

260.title: Was smoking a pipe, Dev Anand was impressed: Zeenat on bagging 'Hare...'
260.article_body: Zeenat Aman opened up about how she bagged the role of Janice in Dev Anand's 'Hare Rama Hare Krishna'. "I think he (Dev) was just impressed with the attitude and the persona I'd at that time," she said, adding, "I was smoking a pipe, wearing a skirt and he thought to himself that I would be perfect for the role."

261.title: 94% of new COVID-19 cases in Karnataka recorded in Bengaluru
261.article_body: Bengaluru on Friday reported 1,008 new coronavirus cases, which is nearly 94% of the total new cases recorded in Karnataka, according to official data. The city also recorded one death due to the virus the same day. The number of active clusters in Bengaluru fell to 13, however, the positivity rate rose to 4.24% as compared to a day earlier.

262.title: 1 injured as bike-borne man fires at pillion rider of another bike in Delhi
262.article_body: A firing incident was reported at 1:23 am on Saturday under Bindapur Police Station limits in Delhi, Dwarka district DCP said. "It's alleged...one of the two persons on a motorcycle fired on the pillion rider of another motorcycle, who is under treatment," the DCP added. "An attempt to murder case has been filed," the DCP further said.

263.title: Delhi Transport Dept gives nod to hike auto, taxi fares by ₹1.50 and ₹15
263.article_body: Delhi Transport Department gave its nod to hike fare prices of auto-rickshaws and taxis by ₹1.50 and ₹15 respectively per kilometre, officials said. The proposal will be tabled in the next cabinet meeting for a final nod, officials added. For AC taxis, meter charges will increase from ₹25 to ₹40 and for non-AC taxis from ₹14 to ₹17 per kilometre.

264.title: Centre promotes more than 8,000 govt employees in one go
264.article_body: The Centre ordered promotion of 8,089 employees belonging to Central Secretariat Service (CSS), Central Secretariat Stenographers' Service (CSSS) and Central Secretariat Clerical Service (CSCS) in one go. Of the 8,089, 4,734 are from CSS, 2,966 from CSSS and 389 from CSCS. "It was disheartening to see...employees [retiring]...without getting...due promotion," Minister Jitendra Singh tweeted.

265.title: Indian forces find 3-yr-old Pakistani boy at border, reunite him with family
265.article_body: A three-year-old Pakistani boy, who inadvertently reached the International Border in Punjab, has been handed over to his family by the Border Security Force. The incident was reported in Ferozepur sector of the state at around 7 pm on Friday when BSF troops noticed the child crying near the International Border fence.

266.title: Buses run on fuel generated from waste on pilot basis in Pune
266.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited on Friday plied buses running on compressed biogas (CBG) generated from wet waste from the city on a pilot basis. "It's a win-win situation as fuel is generated from waste and will help address Pune's garbage situation," Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said. In first trial, 10-15 buses will be run on CBG, PMC added.

267.title: Have utmost respect for religious beliefs: Samsung Pak after being accused of blasphemy
267.article_body: Samsung's Pakistan unit issued a statement as violent protests erupted in a Karachi mall after the multinational company was accused of blasphemy by a mob. Samsung said it "has utmost respect for all religious sentiments", adding that it has initiated a probe into the matter. Reportedly, over 20 Samsung employees were detained over this.

268.title: Criminal conspiracy, evidence destruction charges added against Alt News Co-founder
268.article_body: Delhi Police has added criminal conspiracy and the destruction of evidence charges in the case against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. "The accused received donations from foreign countries," it added. In the FIR, Section 35 in The Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 2010, has now been added. Zubair was arrested in a case related to an alleged objectionable tweet in 2018.

269.title: 15 kg tumour removed from woman’s abdomen at Patna hospital
269.article_body: An ovarian tumour, weighing about 15 kg, was surgically removed from the abdomen of a 40-year-old woman at a government hospital in Patna. The patient was admitted to Nalanda Medical College and Hospital with abdominal pain and swelling complaints. "The tumour was...largest ever to have been surgically extracted in our department," the doctor who headed the surgery said.

270.title: Punjab man stabs 11-yr-old boy to death over minor argument; held
270.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed an 11-year-old boy to death following a minor argument in Punjab's Ludhiana. The boy was selling boiled eggs on a cart near his house when the incident occurred, according to police. The deceased's mother claimed that onlookers had caught the accused, who was holding a "blood-soaked knife in his hand".

271.title: Colombia extradites sister of accused drug cartel leader to US
271.article_body: Colombia has extradited the sister of accused drug cartel leader Dairo Usaga to the US to face drug trafficking charges, police said. Colombian police accuse Nini Usaga of money laundering for the Clan del Golfo cartel and coordinating drug shipments abroad. Her brother, accused head of Clan del Golfo, was extradited to face drug trafficking charges in US in May.

272.title: 5 killed, 12 injured as earthquake of 6.0 magnitude hits Iran
272.article_body: At least five people have been killed and 12 others have been injured after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake hit southern Iran on Saturday, state television reported. Rescue teams have been deployed near the epicentre Sayeh Khosh village, home to around 300 people. Iran's deadliest quake was a 7.4-magnitude tremor that struck in 1990, killing 40,000 people in the country's north.

273.title: Fabulous given India were 98/5: Bishop on Pant-Jadeja's record stand
273.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said the partnership of 222 runs between Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja in India's first innings of the fifth rescheduled Test against England was "fabulous", considering India were 98/5. Their partnership is India's highest-ever stand for the sixth-wicket against England in Test cricket. Pant scored 146 runs while Jadeja is currently unbeaten on 83 runs.

274.title: He has put India so far ahead in the 5th Test: Agarkar on Pant's 146
274.article_body: Former India pacer Ajit Agarkar said Rishabh Pant's 146 in India's first innings of the fifth rescheduled Test against England has put his team "so far ahead" in the ongoing match. "[Pant's style of play] shouldn't come as a surprise. It is...good for India that he has kept repeating it," added Agarkar. "Pant came into the Test...being...under pressure," stated Agarkar.

275.title: PM can't change my behaviour by making me sit in ED office: Rahul
275.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who was questioned recently by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case, said that PM Modi cannot change his behaviour by making him sit in the ED office for five days. "This is a confusion in...mind of the Prime Minister," he added. "My behaviour...can never be shaped by my opponents or...enemies," Rahul further said.

276.title: Manipur landslide worst incident in state's history: CM as death toll rises to 20
276.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Friday said that the landslide in Noney was the "worst incident" in the state's history. This comes as the death toll from the incident rose to 20, according to an Indian Army statement. The CM added that 81 people were lost in the landslide, of which 18 were rescued and 55 are still trapped.

277.title: Saviour has spoken: Arjun after Kartik praises trailer of Ek Villain Returns
277.article_body: Kartik Aaryan took to his Instagram Stories to praise the trailer of Arjun Kapoor's upcoming movie 'Ek Villain Returns', writing, "Superb Trailer. Killing It With The Villains. Mohit Suri sir (director) your world is fantastic as always." Arjun wrote, "Saviour has spoken," reacting to Kartik's post. Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' earned more than ₹200 crore at the worldwide box office.

278.title: What multiple records did Rishabh Pant break with his 146(111) against England?
278.article_body: Rishabh Pant set the record for smashing the fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, taking 89 deliveries during the fifth Test against England. During his 111-ball 146-run knock, Pant also became the youngest Indian to reach 100 sixes in international cricket aged 24 years and 271 days. He also became the youngest wicketkeeper-batter to reach 2,000 Test runs.

279.title: What alternatives can be adopted in daily life as single-use plastic banned in India?
279.article_body: The government has shared some alternatives that can be adopted in daily life as single-use plastic has been banned in India. Khadi bags, bamboo straws and cutlery, stainless steel straws, fluid ear care products and reusable glasses and cups are among the alternatives. Bamboo stirrers and stainless steel lunch boxes can also be used as alternatives.

280.title: Building used as office, not residence: UP govt on Prayagraj demolition
280.article_body: Commenting on demolition of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad's house, Uttar Pradesh government said that the building was not being used for residential purposes but as the office of the Welfare Party of India. It added that the demolition was not connected to the June 10 Prayagraj violence. Javed's wife has moved Allahabad HC claiming the demolition to be illegal.

281.title: 30-yr-old man gets 1-yr jail for shouting ‘I love you’ at minor in Mumbai
281.article_body: A 30-year-old man was sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment for shouting 'I love you' at a 13-year-old girl in 2015. The convict, who lived in the girl's neighbourhood, stalked her for about 15 days. A complaint was lodged against him after he tried to come close to her while she was once returning home with her mother after buying textbooks.

282.title: Shinde, Fadnavis will bring Maha back on track of development: Scindia
282.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Friday welcomed the formation of a new government in Maharashtra under rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde. "I'm confident Shinde as CM and Devendra Fadnavis as Deputy CM will bring Maharashtra back on...road of development," Scindia added. He claimed that the previous MVA government was acting like a speed-breaker in Maharashtra's development.

283.title: Delhi Fire Services to get 89 new additional fire trucks
283.article_body: The Delhi Fire Services (DFS) will soon get 89 new additional fire trucks as the department is currently in the process of purchasing them, officials said. It will help DFS improve their response time and overcome the shortage of fire tenders, DFS Chief Atul Garg said. Notably, DFS' 60 diesel-based fire trucks have reached their expiry time of 10 years.

284.title: India reports 17,092 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,09,568
284.article_body: India has reported 17,092 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 17,070 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,09,568, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,168, according to the latest data.

285.title: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows files for Chapter 15 bankruptcy in US
285.article_body: Cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC) has filed for Chapter 15 of the US Bankruptcy Code, which allows foreign debtors to shield US assets. Singapore-based 3AC is one of the highest-profile investors hit by the sharp sell-off in cryptocurrency markets. Notably, the company had reportedly managed an estimated $10 billion in assets as recently as March.

286.title: J&K Police help Amarnath pilgrims cross flooded bridges, share videos
286.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Friday shared videos of its rescue teams helping pilgrims travelling to Amarnath cave cross two bridges that had got blocked and flooded amid heavy rains. A video shows the police officers standing in a queue as they helped people cross while heavy water flowed. The bridges were located at Brari Marg and Y junction.

287.title: Hope Rocketry becomes as successful as Kashmir Files: Vivek Agnihotri
287.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has reacted to an article saying R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' has the advantage of good word-of-mouth, and is likely to repeat the success of the former's 'The Kashmir Files'. "From the bottom of my heart, I wish this happens and I'm sure it'll happen because Madhavan is one of the most honest [actors]," Vivek said.

288.title: Chef from Taj used to cook for him: Manoj Pahwa recalls eating with Rishi
288.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has said Rishi Kapoor asked him to eat with him during the shoot of 'Mulk' in Lucknow. "A chef from Taj hotel used to cook for him...Being a Kapoor, his food was spread out on the entire table," he added. "There were four types of mutton, four kinds of chicken, five kinds of sweets," Manoj further said.

289.title: Delhi Police arrest murderer absconding for last 15 years
289.article_body: In a 15-year-old kidnapping and murder case, the Delhi Police have arrested the main suspect after hunting him since 2007. The suspect, Hari Om, is accused of abducting and killing a man, Mahesh Choudhary, with the help of his friend, Rakesh, near a village in Kanpur. Notably, Om was arrested from his residence in Kanpur Dehat's Jathiapur village, police said.

290.title: Smoke spotted inside Delhi-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight while it was passing 5,000 feet
290.article_body: A Delhi-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight returned to the Delhi airport after the crew noticed smoke inside the plane while passing 5,000 feet. All the passengers were safely disembarked, a SpiceJet spokesperson said. The SG 2962 flight had taken off at around 6.30 am today and was originally scheduled to reach Jabalpur at around 8 am.

291.title: Bezos' superyacht stuck as firm decides against dismantling bridge to let it sail
291.article_body: Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht is stuck after the Dutch firm building it decided against dismantling a bridge following public backlash, Dutch news outlet Trouw reported. Oceanco had earlier said it needed to have the bridge taken apart in order to allow the superyacht to sail. Trouw used freedom of information legislation to find out more about the firm's plan.

292.title: Public toilet caretaker gets life term for raping 9-yr-old girl in Mumbai
292.article_body: A 25-year-old public toilet caretaker was sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a 9-year-old girl inside the toilet where he worked. The girl said that on November 5, 2019, when she was about to exit the toilet after using it, the convict entered inside and assaulted her sexually. He allegedly gave her ₹20 and threatened her to not reveal anything.

293.title: 46-yr-old man arrested for raping niece for past 5 years in Mumbai
293.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested a 46-year-old man for allegedly sexually exploiting his niece for the past five years. The accused initially raped the 20-year-old victim at a hotel in Andheri and subsequently raped her on multiple occasions at various places, police said. "The accused is said to have videographed some of the acts," said Assistant Police Inspector Santosh Kamble.

294.title: Pak journalist attacked after calling Army generals 'property dealers'
294.article_body: A 73-year-old Pakistan journalist was allegedly assaulted by unidentified men in Lahore on Friday night, a day after calling Pakistan's Army generals "property dealers". Ayaz Amir said the unidentified men dragged him out of his car, hit him and tore his clothes. Ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan condemned the incident, saying, "Pakistan is descending into the worst kind of fascism."

295.title: Stokes ran out of ideas, Eng bowlers lost patience: Zaheer on Day 1
295.article_body: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan said England Test captain Ben Stokes "ran out of ideas" at one stage on Day 1 of the fifth rescheduled Test against India. "The England bowlers lost their patience...After tea...they pitched it either too full or too short. England had to bring in the spinners because of the poor run rate and...tiring pacers," he added.

296.title: Rajasthan government suspends Udaipur ASP days after tailor's beheading
296.article_body: Rajasthan government on Friday suspended Udaipur Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP) Ashok Meena days after a tailor, identified as Kanhaiya Lal, was beheaded by two men. Notably, the order issued by the Joint Secretary (Police) of the state home department does not mention the reason for suspension. Earlier, Rajasthan Police suspended an Assistant Sub-Inspector and a station house officer.

297.title: Pak tech body warns of internet shutdown amid power outages, later deletes tweet
297.article_body: Amid frequent power outages due to the country's economic crisis, Pakistan's National Information Technology Board (NIBT) tweeted that the telecom operators in the country have warned about shutting down mobile and internet services. It added that the long hours of power outages have caused hindrance in their operations. However, NIBT later deleted this tweet.

298.title: If India win the Test, it will be his best knock ever: Jaffer on Pant's 146
298.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's 146 in India's first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England, Wasim Jaffer said, "If India...win the Test and series, this will stand on top of everything (Pant's best knocks)." "It is hard to put anything in front of that [89* at the] Gabba," added Jaffer. Pant's 146 comprised 20 fours and four sixes.

299.title: There was fear of riots under Congress rule in Gujarat: Amit Shah
299.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that people feared riots during Jagannath Rath Yatra under Congress rule in Gujarat. "During Congress rule in Gujarat, have you seen any Rath Yatra procession that has gone smoothly?" Shah asked. "Such incidents of violence occurred back then. Twice, the Lord's [Jagannath] chariot [for the Yatra] was taken away," he added.

300.title: 4 villages to get sewer lines, 3 lakh people to benefit: Delhi Dy CM
300.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that four villages and 36 unauthorised colonies in the national capital will get sewer lines, following which around three lakh people will benefit. The areas include Bijwasan, Najafgarh, Shikarpur, Burari and Sangam Vihar. "Currently, sewage from these areas is discharged into local ponds...which later goes indirectly into the Yamuna," Sisodia added.

301.title: Bengaluru police arrest Nigerian national, seize ₹20 lakh-drugs
301.article_body: A 34-year-old Nigerian national was arrested for allegedly selling prohibited drugs in Bengaluru, DCP (South Division) P Krishnakant tweeted on Friday. The police also seized drugs worth ₹20 lakh, cash, a two-wheeler and a phone from the accused's possession. The accused had come to India on a business visa three years ago and lives a luxurious life, the police said.

302.title: Google to delete users' location history if they visit US abortion clinics
302.article_body: Google has announced it would delete users' location history if they visit US abortion clinics, domestic violence shelters and other places where privacy is sought. This comes a week after the US Supreme Court rolled back abortion rights. Without giving a reference to abortion, Google said it will continue to push back against improper demands for data by the government.

303.title: Hyd will be renamed Bhagyanagar if BJP elected in T'gana: BJP leader
303.article_body: BJP leader and former Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad's name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana. "They [TRS government] don't think about the welfare of the people of Telangana. So people are in favour of BJP," Das claimed. PM Modi will address the national executive meeting to end the dynasty politics, he added.

304.title: Over 300 EV charging stations to come up in Hyderabad
304.article_body: In order to cut down carbon emissions, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to set up 230 electric vehicle (EV) charging stations across the city. Besides this, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) has also proposed to install 100 EV charging stations in its jurisdiction. The stations will reportedly come up in areas where vehicular traffic is heavy.

305.title: 2 attack couple with weapons, rob mangalsutra worth ₹60,000 in Pune
305.article_body: A case was filed after a 42-year-old man and his wife were allegedly attacked by two persons with sword-like weapons in the ghat area in Pune. During the incident, the accused hit the husband on the head and snatched a mangalsutra worth ₹60,000 from the wife, according to police. The accused also stole the husband's phone, a police officer said.

306.title: Uddhav removes Maha CM Shinde as Sena leader over 'anti-party activities'
306.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday removed the new Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde from the post of leader in the party. "You have been indulging in anti-party activities...have also voluntarily given up your membership of Sena," he wrote in a letter addressed to Shinde. "You cannot abandon Sena and claim to be a Sena CM," Thackeray had said earlier.

307.title: US sending 2 surface-to-air missile systems to Ukraine: Pentagon
307.article_body: The US has said it'd provide Ukraine with $820 million in new military aid. Two NASAMS surface-to-air missile systems, four additional counter-artillery radars and up to 150,000 rounds of 155mm artillery ammunition would be sent as part of the package, Pentagon said. The US has now committed around $6.9 billion to Ukraine since Russia began invading it on February 24.

308.title: Actress Alexandra Daddario marries boyfriend Andrew Form, shares pics
308.article_body: Actress Alexandra Daddario tied the knot with her boyfriend, producer Andrew Form. The duo started dating each other in 2021 before getting engaged in August 2021. Daddario took to Instagram to share pictures from her wedding. Daddario's 'Baywatch' co-star Priyanka Chopra congratulated the couple, writing, "Stunning. Congratulations to you both."

309.title: Pic of Dravid's 'screaming' celebration after Pant's hundred goes viral, fans react
309.article_body: A picture of Team India head coach Rahul Dravid's celebration after Rishabh Pant smashed a hundred against England in the rescheduled fifth Test has gone viral. After Pant reached the three-figure mark, Dravid jumped from his chair and screamed with both his hands in the air. "Have never seen Dravid celebrating like this," a fan commented. "Absolute gold," wrote another.

310.title: Sidhu Moosewala's photo seen on election posters in Pakistan; pic surfaces
310.article_body: Photo of singer Sidhu Moosewala was seen on election posters in Pakistan, with a picture of a poster surfacing online. Moosewala's photo was used on the posters of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's party Tehreek-e-Insaf. "This poster has gone very viral because of his picture. None of our posters had gone so viral before," party leader Zain Qureshi said.

311.title: Nearly 700 kg of single-use plastic items seized in Delhi on day 1 of ban
311.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on Friday seized 689.01 kg of single-use plastic items and issued 368 challans on day one of the countrywide ban. "Total of 125 enforcement teams...constituted at the zonal level to eliminate stocking, sale and usage of banned items," MCD said. The ban on single-use plastic items in India came into effect on Friday.

312.title: Pant-Jadeja's record partnership helps India end Day 1 of 5th Test vs England at 338/7
312.article_body: India ended the first day of the rescheduled fifth Test against England at Edgbaston at 338/7. The day witnessed Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja share a partnership of 222 runs, which is the highest-ever sixth-wicket stand for India against England in Test cricket. Pant also broke the record for the fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, taking 89 deliveries.

313.title: UK records over 30% increase in new COVID-19 cases since last week
313.article_body: The UK recorded over 30% increase in the number of new COVID-19 cases in the last week, fueled by the highly contagious Omicron variant, the Office for National Statistics said on Friday. Data showed over 3 million people in the UK had coronavirus in the last week, though a corresponding increase in hospitalisations and related deaths was not seen.

314.title: Sweden, Finland must extradite Kurdish 'terrorists': Turkish Prez
314.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has warned his country's Parliament could still block Sweden and Finland's entry into NATO, if the Nordic nations do not extradite Kurdish leaders designated as "terrorists" by Ankara. Sweden has vowed to extradite 73 people, Erdogan said. Historically neutral Finland and Sweden are set to join NATO, amid a perceived threat from Russia.

315.title: ULFA cadre killed in encounter with forces in Assam's Tinsukia
315.article_body: An encounter broke out between United Liberation Front of Asom cadres and security forces in Assam's Tinsukia district earlier on Friday. Police received information regarding infiltration by six ULFA cadres, following which an operation was launched by security forces, SP Tinsukia informed. An encounter broke out during the operation in which a cadre of the group was killed, he added.

316.title: My saree fell, someone hit my breast: Actress on ordeal after arrest over post on Pawar
316.article_body: Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale, who was arrested over an allegedly derogatory social media post about NCP chief Sharad Pawar, alleged she was molested after her arrest. "I was wearing a sari, my pallu fell down, someone tripped me over, hit me, hit my right breast," she told CNN-News18. "When they hit me, I fell into the police car," she added.

317.title: When in trouble, call Spiderman: Mishra on Pant's ton in 5th Test vs England
317.article_body: Following India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's 89-ball hundred in first innings of rescheduled fifth England-India Test, Amit Mishra tweeted, "When in trouble, call the Spiderman! What a fierce knock by rockstar Pant against a quality English bowling unit under such circumstances." Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "Top knock 100...when team needed the most...keep it up."

318.title: Russian envoy to urge Kremlin to close embassy in Bulgaria
318.article_body: Russia's ambassador to Bulgaria, Eleonora Mitrofanova, on Friday said that she would urge the Kremlin to shut down the Russian embassy in Sofia after the host country ignored Moscow's appeals to reconsider expelling 70 Russian diplomats. She further said that her action "will inevitably entail the closure of the Bulgarian diplomatic mission in Moscow".

319.title: Bangladesh to start deradicalisation campaign for jailed Islamists
319.article_body: Bangladesh will launch a deradicalisation campaign for Islamists in its jails, officials said on Friday. "The initiative is aimed to prevent the jailed militants' return to the path of militancy," a spokesman of police's Counter Terrorism and Transnational Crime (CTTC) unit said. Under the project, the CTTC will rehabilitate 20 militants in the next year, the spokesman added.

320.title: Djokovic beats Kecmanovic to reach Wimbledon last 16 for 14th time
320.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic entered fourth round at Wimbledon for the 14th time after beating fellow Serb Miomir Kecmanovic 6-0, 6-3, 6-4 on Friday. It was his 24th consecutive win on grass. Djokovic will now face Dutch wild card Tim van Rijthoven, who beat Nikoloz Basilashvili 6-4, 6-3, 6-4 to enter fourth round on his Grand Slam main draw debut.

321.title: How much wealth have the world's richest people lost in the last 6 months?
321.article_body: World's 500 richest people lost $1.4 trillion in the first half of 2022, marking the steepest six-month drop ever for the global billionaire group, Bloomberg reported. While the world's richest person Elon Musk lost $61.8 billion, Jeff Bezos saw his wealth decline by $62.7 billion. Mark Zuckerberg's net worth has plunged by more than half to $60 billion in 2022.

322.title: NATO in talks to build naval base in Albania: PM Edi Rama
322.article_body: Albanian PM Edi Rama on Friday said that Albania is in talks with NATO to build a naval base at Porto Romano, a port under construction on its coast. The port will also have a commercial section, Rama added. "We'll soon go back to Brussels to continue our discussions regarding our proposal...for...installation of a NATO naval base," he further said.

323.title: Please stop broadcast of false information: Meena after husband's death
323.article_body: Actress Meena, whose husband recently passed away at the age of 48, penned a note on social media requesting the media to respect her privacy. She wrote, "I am deeply saddened by the loss of my loving husband Vidya Sagar...Please stop further broadcast of any false information on this matter." Meena also thanked her medical team, CM and Health Minister.

324.title: Bajrang Dal, VHP members booked for slogans at Gurugram protest over Udaipur killing
324.article_body: Two days after Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) members staged a protest in Gurugram demanding stringent punishment for the killers of Udaipur tailor, police booked the organisers and participants of the rally. Police said the protesters allegedly raised abusive slogans and tried to promote enmity between communities. At least 80 people had assembled at Nehru Park on Wednesday.

325.title: Encephalitis death rate down by 95%, it will soon be erased: UP CM
325.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday said that the death rate due to encephalitis has gone down by 95% and the disease will soon be eradicated from the state. "Awareness, inter-departmental coordination and teamwork play a big role in this," Yogi Adityanath said. "Affected children should not be taken to quacks, but to specialists in government hospitals," he added.

326.title: US basketball player Griner goes on trial in Russia on drug charges
326.article_body: American professional basketball player Brittney Griner was produced before a Russian court on the outskirts of Moscow on Friday as she went on trial under drug-related charges. Speaking to Reuters, her lawyers refused to disclose if she would plead guilty or not. Griner was detained at a Moscow airport earlier this year for allegedly carrying vaporiser cartridges containing hashish oil.

327.title: Pant smashes fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, breaks Dhoni's record
327.article_body: Rishabh Pant on Friday smashed the fastest hundred by a Team India wicketkeeper in Test cricket. The 24-year-old set the record by reaching the three-figure mark off 89 deliveries against England in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test. The previous fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper was hit by MS Dhoni off 93 deliveries against Pakistan in 2006.

328.title: Accused in Kanhaiya killing paid extra money to get '2611' as his motorbike number
328.article_body: Riyaz Akhtari, a prime accused in Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's beheading, had paid extra money to get '2611' on his bike's registration number, authorities have said. As per reports, the registration number RJ 27 AS 2611 is a reference to 2008 Mumbai terror attacks. The bike has been confiscated and was reportedly used by Akhtari to flee the murder scene.

329.title: Randeep Hooda to hold prayer meet for Sarabjit's sister Dalbir
329.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda will be holding a prayer meeting for Sarabjit Singh's sister Dalbir Kaur on July 4. He had earlier penned a note for her following her demise due to a heart attack. Randeep had also performed her last rites. The actor had reportedly promised he would give 'kandha' (shoulder) to her mortal remains after her death.

330.title: Surbhi Tiwari files FIR against husband, in-laws over domestic violence
330.article_body: Television actress Surbhi Tiwari has filed an FIR against husband Delhi-based pilot and businessman Praveen Kumar Sinha, his mother and his sisters-in-law for domestic violence. She claimed Praveen was supposed to move to Mumbai but later refused. "I haven't got my stree dhan back...If I had...I wouldn't have to sell my gold ornaments for survival and medical expenses," Surbhi said.

331.title: Briton Watson enters Grand Slam singles 4th round in 43rd try at Wimbledon
331.article_body: World number 121 Heather Watson has entered the fourth round of a Grand Slam in singles for the first time in her career after a 7-6(8-6), 6-2 win over Slovenia's Kaja Juvan at Wimbledon 2022 on Friday. This is the Briton's 43rd Grand Slam tournament over 12 years. Meanwhile, third-seeded Ons Jabeur, the 2021 Wimbledon quarter-finalist, has reached fourth round.

332.title: 5 killed due to lightning in Bihar; CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
332.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Friday expressed grief after five people died due to lightning in three districts of the state. The CM further announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh for the family members of each of the deceased. He also requested people to take full vigil in bad weather and follow the suggestions issued by the Disaster Management Department.

333.title: Monkeypox cases in Europe have tripled in last 2 weeks: WHO
333.article_body: World Health Organization's (WHO) Europe chief Hans Kluge on Friday said that monkeypox cases in the region have tripled in the last two weeks. Kluge urged countries to do more to ensure the disease does not become entrenched on the continent. Over 5,000 monkeypox cases have been reported from 51 countries worldwide so far, according to a US health agency.

334.title: People must enjoy 'Ms Marvel': Farhan on the length of his role
334.article_body: Speaking about the short length of his role in 'Ms Marvel', actor Farhan Akhtar said that people must enjoy the show and Kamala's journey. Farhan added he's a part of the show due to Asian representation. His character sacrificed himself to protect Kamala. On being asked if his character is really dead, Farhan said, "I'm not allowed to answer it!"

335.title: Vijay Deverakonda meets fan who tattooed his pic, sign on her back
335.article_body: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda recently met a female fan who got a portrait of his face as well as his signature tattooed on her back along with a heart. The video which has gone viral on social media shows the fan interacting with the actor and breaking down. Vijay can then be seen hugging and consoling her during their interaction.

336.title: Virat Kohli's reaction after getting out for 11(19) in 5th Test against England goes viral
336.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli was dismissed for 11 runs off 19 deliveries in the first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England on Friday. A video of Kohli's reaction after getting bowled has gone viral. In the video, Kohli can be seen smiling before making his way back to the pavilion. Kohli was dismissed by Matthew Potts.

337.title: Sudhir Chaudhary resigns as Zee News CEO, will start own enterprise
337.article_body: Zee News Editor-in-Chief and CEO Sudhir Chaudhary has resigned from his position. In his resignation letter addressed to Essel Group chairman Subhash Chandra, Chaudhary said his decision was a "result of his internal deliberations" to "start his own enterprise". He also sought blessings from Chandra while parting ways with the company "with heavy heart".

338.title: Steve Jobs, Simone Biles, 15 others to receive US' highest civilian honour
338.article_body: US President Joe Biden has announced 17 recipients of the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the US' highest civilian honour. The award will be presented to Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs, four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles, actor Denzel Washington, and Olympic gold medalist soccer player Megan Rapinoe. "These...Americans demonstrate the power of possibilities," the White House said.

339.title: Opening a new chapter in ties with France: Aus after submarine row
339.article_body: During a visit to Paris, Australian PM Anthony Albanese said that Australia and France are opening up a new chapter in their relationship. This comes after tensions between the two countries rose briefly following Australia's cancellation of a deal to buy French-made submarines. "He's not responsible for what happened...We'll speak about the future, not the past," the French President said.

340.title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari's convoy hit by speeding truck
340.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari on Friday said that a heavy vehicle rammed into a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) escort car of his convoy. "By the grace of Lord Jagannath, nobody was hurt. I am not injured and will continue attending scheduled events. I am grateful for the innumerous calls enquiring about my well-being," Adhikari added.

341.title: We'll do good job as Opp'n, win back people's trust: Maha NCP chief
341.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil said that his party will do a good job as the Opposition and win back people's trust. The three parties of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) will nominate a common candidate for the Assembly Speaker's post, he added. Speaking about ED summons to Sanjay Raut, he said, "He's innocent and we have no doubt about it."

342.title: 2 workers die while cleaning septic tank in Chennai, 2 arrested
342.article_body: Two workers cleaning a septic tank inside a gated community in Chennai's Perungudi died after inhaling poisonous gas on Wednesday evening. The police have arrested the building secretary who's an ex-serviceman and the supervisor in the case. The workers P Periyasamy and D Dhatchanamoorthy, both 38 years old, had been doing such work for the past five years, police said.

343.title: List shows 36 cricketers who have captained India in Test cricket
343.article_body: Jasprit Bumrah on Friday became the 36th cricketer to captain India in Test cricket. As many as 303 players have represented the country in Tests, with 36 of them going on to lead the nation. Cottari Kanakaiya Nayudu was the first captain of Indian Test team. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli holds the record for captaining India in most Tests (68).

344.title: Remove all content justifying Udaipur man's killing: Govt to social media platforms
344.article_body: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has directed social media platforms to immediately remove all content that "seem to encourage/glorify/justify" the beheading of Udaipur man Kanhaiya Lal. This is to prevent any incitement and disruption of public order and to restore public peace and harmony, the Ministry said. Meta said it has designated the incident as "violating".
