345.title: I thought he'd get to T20 WC 2022: Buttler on Morgan's retirement
345.article_body: Commenting on ex-England limited-overs captain Eoin Morgan's retirement from international cricket, Jos Buttler said he thought Morgan would play T20 World Cup 2022. "Thought that was what he was working towards, but he's always said...if he felt like the time came and he obviously said that that came in Amsterdam," he added. Buttler was appointed as England's new white-ball skipper.

346.title: Udaipur incident shows Taliban mentality: Haryana Home Minister
346.article_body: Haryana's Home Minister Anil Vij has said that Kanhaiya Lal's killing shows a "Taliban mentality" and that it needs to be eradicated from India. He added, "We'll take all necessary steps to tackle such a mentality." Two more people have been arrested in connection with the case for their alleged involvement in hatching the conspiracy, IG Udaipur said on Friday.

347.title: Punjab households to get 300 units of free electricity from today: CM Mann
347.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said households across the state will get 300 units of free electricity each month from today. "This means that people will get zero amount bills. All electricity bills prior to December 31, 2021 will be waived off," Mann further said. AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while congratulating Punjab's citizens, said, "We've fulfilled our promise."

348.title: 'Fluffy' crab that wears a sponge as a hat discovered in Australia, pics released
348.article_body: A new species of crabs, with its body covered in fluff and hair, was discovered off the coast of Western Australia. The species, Lamarckdromia beagle, belongs to the Dromiidae family, commonly known as sponge crabs. Crustaceans in this family fashion and use sea sponges and ascidians for protection. They trim the creatures using their claws and wear them like hats.

349.title: India calls on Pak to release 536 Indian fishermen & 3 civilians
349.article_body: India on Friday called on Pakistan to release and repatriate 536 Indian fishermen and three civilian prisoners. India made the demand as the two countries exchanged lists of fishermen and prisoners today under an agreement. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) handed over a list of 309 Pakistani civilian prisoners and 95 fishermen in India's custody to Pakistan.

350.title: Who is SC Justice Surya Kant, who criticised Nupur Sharma for remarks on Prophet?
350.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Surya Kant, who severely criticised Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet, was elevated to the apex court in May 2019. He started his law practice in Haryana in 1984 and was appointed as the youngest Advocate General of Haryana in July 2000. Kant is on the bench for important cases like Article 370, Pegasus spyware, CAA etc.

351.title: Over 10 injured as roof of cabin collapses on Guj Rath Yatra route
351.article_body: Around 10-15 people sustained injuries when the roof of a cabin they were sitting on caved in on the route of Jagannath Rath Yatra in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday. Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi was reportedly walking along with the procession when the incident took place. "Policemen rushed to the spot and helped all of them," Sanghavi said.

352.title: Raj Thackeray hails Fadnavis for accepting Maha's Deputy CM's post
352.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Friday congratulated Devendra Fadnavis on becoming Maharashtra's Deputy CM. "Everyone thought...you'll become CM, but sometimes one has to accept party's instructions," he wrote in a letter to Fadnavis. "Party's order is greater than anyone's ambition, you have shown it from your actions. This should be remembered by every political party worker and leader," he added.

353.title: We need to work on partnerships: Harmanpreet on India Women's 1st ODI win
353.article_body: Following India Women's four-wicket win against Sri Lanka Women in first ODI, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said the team needs to work on partnerships. Harmanpreet Kaur(44) and Harleen Deol(34) added a 62-run partnership for the fourth wicket. Deepti(22*) put on an unbeaten 38-run seventh-wicket stand with Pooja Vastrakar(21*) to help chase the 172-run target with 12 overs to spare.

354.title: Maoist carrying ₹5 lakh reward killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
354.article_body: Police said that a Maoist carrying a reward of ₹5 lakh on his head was killed in an encounter with jawans of the District Reserve Guard (DRG) in Chhattisgarh's Sukma on Friday. "After the encounter ended, we recovered the body of a male Maoist...initially identified as Kamlesh, Malenger Area Committee Member," Sundarraj P, IG Bastar range, said.

355.title: England announce squads for their T20I and ODI series against India
355.article_body: England have announced their squads for the upcoming T20I and ODI series against India. The T20I and ODI series will be the first for Jos Buttler as England's full-time white-ball captain. Lancashire's 34-year-old fast bowler Richard Gleeson has earned his first full England call-up for the T20I series. Ex-England captain Joe Root has been included in the ODI squad.

356.title: Former DE Shaw partner fired for sexual misconduct wins record $52 million in US
356.article_body: A former partner at American hedge fund DE Shaw, who was fired at the start of the #MeToo movement in 2018, has been awarded record $52 million by an arbitration panel in the US. Daniel Michalow had filed a defamation complaint against DE Shaw seeking $600 million in damages. The panel also found that Michalow "did not commit sexual misconduct".

357.title: Received death threat from Sidhu Moosewala's murderers: Manu Punjabi
357.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 10' contestant Manu Punjabi has claimed that he received a death threat from the gang that murdered Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. He took to Twitter to thank Jaipur Police for giving him security and catching hold of the culprit who sent him the email demanding ₹10 lakh. Manu also posted a screenshot of the email.

358.title: 1 in 5 houses in Bengal faced food crisis during lockdown: Report
358.article_body: A report released by Nobel laureate Amartya Sen-led Pratichi (India) Trust said that at least one in every five households in West Bengal faced "some food crisis" during the lockdown period in the first wave of COVID-19. "A majority of these households suffered for about 60 days," it added. Over 2,000 households had participated in the survey, the report mentioned.

359.title: Over 50 hurt as KSRTC, pvt bus crash against each other in K'taka
359.article_body: More than 50 passengers were left injured after a private bus and a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus crashed against each other on the Shivamogga-Sringeri road. As per reports, there were more than 35 passengers on the private bus and over 45 passengers on the KSRTC bus.

360.title: 5 terrorists arrested in Srinagar & Sopore, arms cache recovered
360.article_body: A hybrid terrorist was arrested on Thursday in Srinagar with a pistol, police said. Upon interrogating him, another hybrid terrorist was nabbed from Pampore with three pistols, police added. A grenade, bullets, gelatin sticks and detonators were also recovered from the duo, as per police. In Sopore, police said three terrorists were intercepted with an assault rifle, grenade and pistols.

361.title: I am the one who started the pan-India films trend: Madhavan
361.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has stated that he is the one who started the trend of pan-India films, adding that the rest of the world is catching up to him. "'Ramji Londonwaley' or '13B', which was one of the first films to be shot simultaneously, 'Rocketry' has the distinction of being shot in three languages, forget about two," the actor added.

362.title: A nothing shot: Shastri on Gill's dismissal at 17 in 5th Test vs England
362.article_body: Reacting to Shubman Gill's dismissal at 17 in fifth Test against England in Edgbaston, Ravi Shastri said it's unfortunate and the India opener needed to bring discipline into his game. On a James Anderson delivery, Gill was caught by Zak Crawley at the second slip. "That's a nothing shot...he'll be disappointed with it. This is a boundary-scoring ground," he added.

363.title: Taking extra care: Nadal after 3 players pulled out of Wimbledon due to COVID
363.article_body: Second seed Rafael Nadal said he is taking extra precautions and not doing many things after three COVID positive men's singles players withdrew from Wimbledon 2022. "Just staying here and staying in the house, not going out at all anymore," he added. Nadal, who won his 22nd Grand Slam last month, entered the third round on Thursday.

364.title: Rahul visits vandalised Wayanad office, calls act 'unfortunate'
364.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Friday visited his office in Kerala's Wayanad, which was allegedly vandalised by CPI(M)'s student wing Students' Federation of India (SFI) last week. Gandhi said, "It's unfortunate what happened. Violence never resolves problems." "I don't have any anger or hostility towards them. They are kids and they don't understand the consequences of their act," he added.

365.title: 78-yr-old woman told to pay ₹25,000/month alimony to 83-yr-old ex-husband in Pune
365.article_body: A Pune family court told a 78-year-old woman to pay interim alimony of ₹25,000 per month to her 83-year-old estranged husband. The husband had filed for divorce from his wife of 55 years in 2019 and sought alimony alleging that he was repeatedly harassed by her. The couple also reportedly accused each other of having extramarital affairs.

366.title: HDFC yet to recover funds after sending ₹1,000 cr to some accounts due to glitch: Report
366.article_body: HDFC Bank is still attempting to recover funds from some customers in Tamil Nadu after it mistakenly transferred ₹1,000 crore into their accounts in May, BQ Prime reported. About ₹35-40 crore continues to remain with customers, the report said. The transfer of funds was caused due to a technical glitch, following which HDFC briefly froze many of these bank accounts.

367.title: US fails to secure release of Americans imprisoned in Venezuela
367.article_body: A delegation led by US Special Envoy for Hostage Affairs, Roger Carstens, on Thursday failed to secure the release of American citizens imprisoned in Venezuela, US officials informed. "The trip focused on...wrongfully detained U.S. nationals in Venezuela and to press for their release," the State Department stated. The department added that Carstens met the detainees to "assess their well-being".

368.title: What is earthshine, the phenomenon that will make the Moon glow this weekend?
368.article_body: A new Moon occurs when all of Sun's light is reflected away from Earth, and the side of Moon facing Earth is barely visible. Sometimes the dark face of Moon catches Earth's reflected glow and returns that light. This phenomenon is called earthshine. The earthshine Moon will be visible for next few days but will be brightest over the weekend.

369.title: 14 mobile forensic labs launched by Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin
369.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin launched 14 mobile forensic labs in Chennai to facilitate preliminary examination at the scene of the crime. The mobile vans have been custom-built at an estimated cost of ₹3.92 crore. Stalin also lauded the Forensic Sciences Department for getting the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories international certification for its main lab.

370.title: Congrats on car, but tomorrow isn't 'kol': Anirban criticises Kartik's Bengali
370.article_body: Actor Anirban Bhattacharya recently criticised actor Kartik Aaryan's Bengali accent in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' on social media. He tweeted, "Congratulations [on] your new car/Chinese food table. Just remember 'tomorrow' is not 'kol' or 'call' in bangla. It's 'kaal'." Kartik was recently gifted a McLaren GT worth ₹3.73 crore by 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' producer Bhushan Kumar following the film's success.

371.title: 60-yr-old Mysore University staffer found dead on day of retirement
371.article_body: A 60-year-old employee of the University of Mysore in Karnataka was found dead with his throat slit on the day of his retirement, police said. "We are investigating the case and so far, we have no information on the killers," DCP (Crime) Geetha Prasanna said. The deceased was a resident of Kanakagiri in the city, police added.

372.title: Sidhu Moosewala, Lata Mangeshkar among top 5 most Googled Asians
372.article_body: Google has released its list of most searched Asians worldwide which features late singers Sidhu Moosewala and Lata Mangeshkar at the third and fifth spots respectively. Actresses Katrina Kaif, Alia Bhatt and Priyanka Chopra are seventh, eighth and ninth on the list. Virat Kohli is in the tenth spot and Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan are eleventh and twelfth.

373.title: 30,260 kg of spurious cumin seized from a godown in Gujarat's Unjha
373.article_body: The Food and Drugs Control Administration (FDCA) seized 30,260 kg of spurious cumin seeds and raw materials from a godown in Gujarat's Unjha. "The accused used to mix the spurious cumin with the real one...to prevent customers from detecting the presence of the spurious material," FDCA Commissioner said. Unjha is the biggest market and exporting centre for spices.

374.title: Odisha CM Patnaik pulls chariot during Jagannath Rath Yatra in Puri
374.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik participated in the Jagannath Rath Yatra in Puri on Friday. He was also seen pulling the chariot, along with Governor Ganeshi Lal and Union minister Dharmendra Pradhan. CM Patnaik also introduced the Srimandir Heritage Corridor project to curb challenges during the Rath Yatra, according to officials.

375.title: Nadal is one of the greatest players, he always intimidates me: Gauff
375.article_body: World number 12 Coco Gauff has said 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's words mean a lot to her. "Rafa is one of the greatest in this sport, if not the greatest. I see him in...players' area, he's very nice. He always intimidates me because he is Rafa," she added. Meanwhile, the 18-year-old entered Wimbledon 2022 third round on Thursday.

376.title: Kate Winslet's 1st look from Avatar 2 revealed, pic goes viral
376.article_body: Kate Winslet's look as Ronal was exclusively revealed on the cover of the Empire magazine's special Avatar edition. 'Avatar: The Way of Water', the sequel to 'Avatar', has been directed by James Cameron. Speaking about her character, Kate told Empire, "She is deeply loyal and a fearless leader." The film is scheduled to arrive in theatres on December 16, 2022

377.title: Man shares pic of ₹70 bill for 1 tea on Shatabdi Express, officials explain charges
377.article_body: A Shatabdi Express passenger shared a picture of a bill charging him ₹70 (₹20 + ₹50 GST) for a single cup of tea on the train. Railway officials, however, explained that as per a 2018 order, passengers of Rajdhani/Shatabdi/Duronto trains who don't book meals while reserving seats will have to pay a ₹50 service charge per meal.

378.title: It's like all mess went loose: Urmila on judgment over entering politics
378.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar spoke about the judgment she faced on entering politics, saying, "It was like all the mess went loose, everything went baloney." She added that being known as a sex symbol, she was expected to be dumb and clueless. Urmila further said the joke was on the journalists who flew down to Mumbai to film her political campaign.

379.title: Bengaluru to have amenities of international standards: K'taka CM
379.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said, "We have resolved to develop Bengaluru into a city with amenities of international standards and we are committed to make it a reality." "Our government is committed for the comprehensive development of Bengaluru," he added. Bommai blamed the present civic woes of the city on the previous governments.

380.title: Monsoon Session of Parliament to start from July 18
380.article_body: The Monsoon Session of Parliament will begin on July 18 and conclude on August 12, according to a press release by the Lok Sabha Secretariat. The session will have 18 sittings, the secretariat said. Notably, the session usually commences in the third week of July and concludes ahead of Independence Day, according to a report.

381.title: Have 170 MLAs' support, number increasing: Maha CM Shinde ahead of floor test
381.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday said that the new state government, formed in alliance with the BJP, has the support of 170 MLAs. "The number is increasing. We have a comfortable majority in the Assembly," Shinde added. State Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked Shinde to prove a majority in the Assembly on July 4.

382.title: I would've supported Droupadi Murmu had BJP informed earlier: WB CM
382.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that she could've considered Droupadi Murmu, the NDA's Presidential candidate, as the consensus candidate had the BJP consulted her over the nomination. "If...BJP had informed us...that they were backing a tribal lady as the Presidential candidate, then we would've supported her," she said. "Murmu is more likely to win the polls," she added.

383.title: WhatsApp banned over 19 lakh Indian accounts in May
383.article_body: WhatsApp banned 19.1 lakh Indian accounts in May 2022, the Meta-owned messaging platform said in its monthly report under the Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021. Between May 1 and May 31, WhatsApp received 528 grievance reports, out of which 303 reports were for ban appeal. It took remedial action against 24 of these reports.

384.title: Mumbai history-sheeter arrested with drugs worth ₹23.5 lakh
384.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of the Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested a 32-year-old history-sheeter, Nasir Qureshi and recovered 156 grams of mephedrone worth ₹23.50 lakh. He was arrested during a routine patrol in Kurla. "It's a commercial quantity and hence Qureshi was placed under arrest and charged under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act," an ANC officer said.

385.title: 68 more pelican traffic signals set up to make road crossings safer in Hyd
385.article_body: To allow pedestrians to cross roads safely, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has set up 68 pelican traffic signals on intersection points near schools, colleges and hospitals. These signals are manually-controlled and pedestrians can get 15 seconds to cross the road by pressing a button on them. GHMC is planning to set up 26 more pelican signals in Hyderabad.

386.title: Vidyut climbs down scaffolding for selfie with construction worker
386.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal on Friday shared a video on Instagram interacting with a construction worker from a balcony who said he is a fan of the actor. Vidyut can be seen praising the worker, saying he does more stunts every day than actors do in films. He then climbed down the scaffolding to click a selfie with the worker.

387.title: India Women defeat SL Women in Harmanpreet's 1st ODI as full-time captain
387.article_body: India Women defeated Sri Lanka Women by four wickets in first ODI in Pallekele on Friday. It was Harmanpreet Kaur's first match as full-time India ODI skipper. Chasing 172, India scored 176/6 in 38 overs, with Harmanpreet top-scoring with 44(63). All-rounder Deepti Sharma scored 22* and took three wickets, while other all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar hit 21* and scalped two wickets.

388.title: Which startups are likely to become unicorns in next 2 years as per Hurun?
388.article_body: Hurun India's 'ASK Private Wealth Hurun India Future Unicorn Index 2022' has identified 51 'gazelles', or startups founded after 2000 that have the potential to become a unicorn in the next two years. Among these, Shiprocket is the most valuable startup, followed by Zepto and Turtlemint. The list also includes startups such as Ather Energy, Ninjacart, Dunzo, Rapido, ClearTax, Gaana.

389.title: Thane man gets 6 yrs in jail for sexually assaulting 9-yr-old girl
389.article_body: A special court in Thane sentenced a man, Ganesh, to six years of rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting a nine-year-old girl. The court also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on him. The incident took place in May 2015, when the girl was playing outside and Ganesh took her to an isolated place and sexually assaulted her, special public prosecutor said.

390.title: Rachakonda Police arrest burglar, gold & cash worth ₹4.6 lakh seized
390.article_body: The Rachakonda Police arrested a 37-year-old habitual inter-state house burglar, identified as Brahmadevi Raja Ganesh alias Rajaiah from his residence in Khairatabad and recovered ₹1 lakh cash from him. The police also seized three tolas of gold ornaments, 22 tolas of silver, two motorcycles and eight mobile phones worth a total of ₹4.65 lakh from him.

391.title: International Criminal Court marks 20th anniversary of establishment
391.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) marked the 20th anniversary of its establishment on Friday. Currently, the ICC has investigations underway in 17 countries, with a majority of them being in Africa. A total of 123 countries are members of the court and accept its jurisdiction, but countries like the US, Russia and China do not.

392.title: Sindhu, Prannoy crash out of Malaysia Open 2022, lose in quarters
392.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu crashed out in the women's singles quarter-final at Malaysia Open 2022 after losing to second seeded Tai Tzu Ying on Friday. Sindhu, seeded seventh, lost 21-13, 15-21, 13-21 in 53 minutes. In the men's singles quarter-final, seventh seeded Jonatan Christie beat India's HS Prannoy 21-18, 21-16. With this the Indian campaign has ended.

393.title: I'm just trying to take the complexities out of batting: Bairstow
393.article_body: Talking about his aggressive style of play, England batter Jonny Bairstow said, "I'm trying to remain as clear as possible...have no doubts about my ability or the way I'm going about my batting." He added, "I'm just trying to take the complexities out of batting." Bairstow slammed the second-fastest century and fifty for England in Tests against New Zealand recently.

394.title: Will support NDA's Prez candidate Murmu: Shiromani Akali Dal chief
394.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Friday said, "We have decided to support National Democratic Alliance's (NDA) Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu." "We will never go with Congress because of the atrocities they have committed on the Sikh community," he further said. "Akali Dal has always supported people from marginalised sections of society," Badal added.

395.title: Plea seeking withdrawal of SC Justice's remarks on Nupur Sharma filed before CJI
395.article_body: A letter petition has been filed before the Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana, which seeks the withdrawal of Justice Surya Kant's observations on suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. Gau Mahasabha leader Ajay Gautam said that Justice Kant's remarks on Sharma should be declared "uncalled for". Justice Kant held Sharma "single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country".

396.title: You're not just Nupur's PM, how long you'll save her: Owaisi to PM
396.article_body: After the Supreme Court criticised suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma for her comments on Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned, "Will [PM Narendra Modi] issue a statement or not?" "You're not just Nupur's PM. You're the PM of the 133 crore-strong India which has nearly 20 crore Muslims. How long will you save her?" he further asked PM Modi.

397.title: 2 more arrested for Kanhaiya Lal's killing, were involved in preparation for crime
397.article_body: Police said that two more men have been arrested in connection to the beheading of Udaipur man Kanhaiya Lal who had supported Nupur Sharma on social media. "They were involved in the conspiracy and preparation behind the entire crime," said Udaipur IG Prafulla Kumar. The two main accused Riyaz Akhtari and Gaus Mohammad were arrested earlier.

398.title: What's included & what's not as 1% TDS on virtual digital assets comes into effect?
398.article_body: The rules governing the imposition of 1% TDS on the transfer of virtual digital assets (VDAs) of more than ₹10,000 has come into effect from today. All cryptocurrencies and NFTs, except tangible asset-backed NFTs, will be subject to TDS deduction. Further, the government has clarified that gift cards or vouchers, mileage points, reward points, and website subscriptions are not VDAs.

399.title: 16 dead so far in Manipur landslide, rescue op for over 50 underway
399.article_body: The death toll due to a landslide, which hit Tupul railway station in Manipur's Noney district, increased to 16 on Friday. "We hope to complete the search and rescue operations within two to three days. The soil is so soft that hardly any movement is possible," CM N Biren Singh said. Search operations are reportedly underway for over 50 people.

400.title: Cameron Diaz to make comeback with Netflix film 'Back In Action'
400.article_body: Actress Cameron Diaz will be making her comeback alongside actor Jamie Foxx in Netflix's upcoming film 'Back In Action'. Notably, the two actors have earlier worked together in 'Any Given Sunday' (1999) and the 'Annie' remake, which released in 2014. 'Back In Action' will be directed by Seth Gordon and the shoot is expected to begin later this year.
